loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is a 37-years-old married man from Dier El-Balah city. He lives with his wife and two sons in a small house. He works in selling books in his own book store where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs.
 
Yaser took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. this will help him to provide hot water without using electricity. 

Yaser appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina has run her market stall for years now and she makes a good income from this. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs, especially for her children. She and his husband are determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have.

She sells meat, fish and vegetable products in the community market. She buys quantity of processed meat products, different types of fish and fresh vegetables and sells it per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

Dina is requesting a Php 20,000 loan assistance to purchase more quantities of veggies and stocks of processed meats and also fish to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Dina hopes to expand her stall and earn enough to buy a house for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fish, meat, vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 21 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. Mohammad is studying for a bachelor's degree, majoring in business administration. He is in his third year. He is planning to find a better job after his graduation with good income to help his family in the household expenses. 

Lately his family has been faced a financial crises which prevents them from paying the university fees for Mohammad; therefore he is applying for a loan to pay for his university fees and buy books and supplies for his major.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees and buy books and supplies for his major.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is the age of 40 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four daughters.

Her husband has been running a restaurant for many years and handling the financial condition of his house. This restaurant has been supporting his whole family for many years. Nowadays, he wants to offer more menu items to his valuable customers so that he can grow his income.

Shagufta is requesting a loan for the restaurant establishment. In fact, her husband wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses (dry beans), bread, butter, yogurt, etc. Shagufta is hopeful that this loan would be the cause to generate more profit and savings, as well.

Shagufta thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help Shagufta's husband in purchasing chicken, beef, pulses (dry beans), bread, butter, yogurt, etc for his restaurant.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is the age of 51, the mother of five children, and living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a green grocer by profession; he has been selling fresh vegetable at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her son offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. Therefore he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables. 

So, Khursheed applied for loan so that her son would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

Khursheed is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her son's vegetable sale business

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es:
José, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, se casó a los 27 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, sus hijos viven en su casa. 

José, aprendió con su papá desde que era joven el trabajo de albañilería y la agricultura, para la subsistencia y el consumo familiar.- También cuida una vaca preñada, que mantiene con el forraje que le queda del maíz que cultiva. 

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar un vehículo, que servirá para ir al mercado a realizar las compras con su esposa, para el comedor que ella administra.

En el futuro espera ver a sus hijos preparados académicamente y dejar de trabajar en construcciones para dedicarse al negocio del comedor en su casa.
texts.en: José is 55 years old. He studied until sixth grade. He got married at 27 and has five children. His children live in his house. With his father since he was very young, José learned the job of masonry and agriculture for subsistence and family consumption. He also takes care of a pregnant cow, which he maintains with the remaining fodder from the corn that he cultivates. He needs the loan money to buy a vehicle, which will be useful to go to the market with his wife to shop for the diner that she manages. In the future, he hopes to see his children educated academically, and to stop working in constructions in order to devote himself to the business of a diner in his house.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn, a physician for soldiers and now a farmer, lives with his wife and five children. He and his wife (both in the picture standing in front of their house) get up early to do farming on their five-hectare land. Sometimes, when Sophorn receives a call from a patient, he will go to the patient's house directly for elementary help or first aid. 

Living in an off-power-grid area, Sophorn and wife want a comfortable lifestyle. They want enough home energy for their business and also their family's needs. Having heard of the benefits of solar home systems from their relative, they decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy solar home systems. They believe these will improve their business and also their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for solar home systems

location.town: Taing Khlai Village, Svay Chirj commune, Samaki Me

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur is a young man who is 23 years old, unmarried and a graduate of the agricultural college in the village of Taul. After graduation from college he went to study ecology at the University of Economic Policy Studies (USPEE) located in Chisinau the capital of Moldova. Though not having enough money after the first year to continue his studies full-time he had to reduce the amount of classes and start working to continue to be able to pay for University. He is now currently in his fourth year and still continues to work and go to school part time. For the last three years he has been living with his parents in the village he grew up in and works for a local agricultural company. While working for the agricultural company cultivating apple orchards, he took the knowledge and experience he learned and applied it to start his own business. For the first year of his business he rented an orchard with 2.3 hectares and worked out a deal to use the machinery from where he works to cultivate and harvest his orchard. Now with the help of his parents he has been able expand his apple orchard to 7 hectares. Though now he has run into a problem with the machinery he needs. As stated above he had worked out a deal to use the machinery from where he works to cultivate and harvest his own orchard. The problem now is that the machinery he needs is busy during the most important times which are harvest and watering seasons. With the machinery he needed busy during the key harvest time he was unable to harvest his apples in time and most of his apples froze right on the trees which resulted in big losses. For his business to prosper Artur would like to purchase his own agricultural machinery: a tractor, a sprinkler and a plug, all would be second hand. After the purchase of the agricultural machinery he will be able to perform necessary work in the right timing and will be able to bring in a good harvest that will result in profit not losses.

loans.use: To pay for agricultural machinery to maintain and harvest crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming by employing modern farming equipment to increase her productivity.

loans.name: Rukmsha Pir Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Kulsum, Hamid, Sabana, Nurbai and Jamila hail from Kutch in Gujarat, India. They are led by their group leader Kulsum who is seen standing in the center. Kulsum is 29 years old and is the mother of one child. Kulsum's household income is about 11,000 INR per month. After meeting all the expenses, she is able to save only 2500 INR a month.This is insufficient to give a good education to her only child. Kulsum thus started her own business. She is into selling products made of milk. She sells milk, butter milk, butter, cheese, paneer, curd, etc. In order to give a better education to her child, she wants to earn more and save better. She currently earns 5000 INR a month, which she is not satisfied with. She desires to earn at least 8000 INR a month. For this reason she has decided to avail herself of an enterprise loan. She has also formed a group with similar minded women who are seeking to expand their business. 

The other women take care of household needs and also pursue individual businesses in order to support their families. On average these women earn 10,000 INR a month out of which they are able to save only 2000 INR after meeting all the household expenses. Similar to Kulsum, they also sell milk products and make a living by selling these products in the market. They all want to buy more milk products in bulk and sell them in the market so that they can gain additional income. Hence they are here seeking a loan of 75,000 INR. Your loan will help these women earn better and save more.

loans.use: to fund their milk product sales business.

loans.name: Saif-Aldeen

texts.en:
Saif-Aldeen lives with his mother in Irbid, who is an example for an ambitious and positive guy.  Saif-Aldeen is 20 years old. He is studying at the university, majoring in Accounting, and he wishes to complete his higher education to make a good change for him.

Therefore Saif-Aldeen asked for an education loan to cover his university fees and complete his education to find a good job, because his parents could not cover his tuition fees due to their financial situation.

loans.use: To cover his university fees and complete his education to find a good job

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 51-year-old married woman, living along with her four sons, a daughter and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has owned a small general store for many years; he has only single source of income to run his house. For the growth of business, he wants to start selling cold drinks, soft drinks and mineral water. His customers demand for cold drinks, so that he decided to offer drinks also but he does not have a refrigerator for the preservation of drinks and savings as well.

Therefore, Shagufta requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy a refrigerator and have cold drinks to offer. In this way he will win the trust of his customers and can generate excess income also. 

His family needs are growing day by day; he can easily cope and handle the critical situations easily. 

Shagufta is very thankful to the Kiva and hopes that the Kiva lenders would support her.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and cold drinks so her son can meet the demand.

loans.name: Lanya

texts.en:
Lanya was born in 1980. She is married and lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat. She lives with her husband and with her three children. 

Lanya has been helping her husband financially by running a business selling cosmetics and hand watches for many years; she started it with a small quantity of products. 

Now she needs to expand her business by purchasing accessories in order to increase her profits. However, she doesn’t have enough money to do so. 

For this reason, she has applied for this loan to buy accessories to sell and improve the standard of living for her children.

loans.use: To buy accessories to sell and improve the standard of living for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for her husband's milk sales business

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Who would believe that there is still money in junk? While many people find them as useless, Antonio, 54 years old, still finds them as a way to generate a living. 

Here it goes.
 
Since trash is not well managed in the country and is just thrown anywhere along the sidewalks and riverbanks, street dwellers usually collect such things that are still recyclable from junk, like copper, papers, plastics and metals. After collecting, their next destination is to the junk shop where they sell such for a corresponding price depending on the material. Usually, metal costs are higher. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries and factories. 

However, stable income from this kind of business is hardly predictable. Sometimes, the revolving fund that the junk shop operators use is not enough. 

This is why Antonio is taking out a loan worth PHP 11,000 to add to his current revolving fund and to use for improving the shop. 

With her wife, Cecilia, they are truly hopeful that someday their lives will get better and they will be able to renovate their house. He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To add up to his current revolving fund and to use for improving the shop.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is 25 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Jabalia in a small house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income, which barely covers all the family needs.

Samah requested a loan from FATEN, which she will use to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house, providing them hot water without using electricity.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy the ingredients for her meals: flour, molds, cheeses, snacks, meats, vegetables and others.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal was born in 1970. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa with her husband, who is retired. and with their four children. 

Amal has been helping her husband financially by running her project of selling blankets for six years. She started it with a small quantity of products, and now she needs to expand her project by purchasing a larger quantity of blankets and new products to increase her income. 

Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy what she needs, like supplies and products to sell to expand her business and develop it.

loans.use: To buy supplies and products to sell to expand her business and develop it.

loans.name: Magdalena Saraí

texts.es:
Magdalena  es una joven muy trabajadora de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado pues sus padres ya no podían seguir ayudándole en sus estudios, está soltera y vive junto con sus padres y 3 hermanos más.
	
Magdalena se dedica a los oficios domésticos, esto lo aprendió de su madre que ha sido un ejemplo para ella, Magdalena trabaja como cocinera en un comedor desde hace 1 año, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 de la mañana a 5:00 de la tarde para lo cual tiene que caminar media hora desde su casa hacia el trabajo, todo su esfuerzo le sirve mucha a ella ya que puede ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para sembrar granos básicos con su familia, esto le será de mucha ayuda pues podrán trabajar juntos para poder superarse.

Ella considera que nunca es tarde para superarse es por eso que sueña con retomar sus estudios y que esto le abra mayores oportunidades para optar por un mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
Magdalena, age 23, is a very hard-working young woman.  She went to school through the eighth grade.  Her parents were no longer able to continue helping her with her education.  She is single, and she lives with her parents and three siblings.

Magdalena devotes herself to the household chores.  She learned this from her mother, who has been an example for her.  Magdalena has been working as a cook at an eatery for one year.  Her work schedule is from six in the morning until five in the afternoon.  She has to walk a half an hour from her house to her work.  All of her effort has helped her a lot because she can help with the household expenses.

She needs this loan to buy compost and fertilizers and to pay for the labor to plant basic grains with her family.  This will be a big help because they will be able to work together so that they are able to succeed.

She thinks that it is never too late to improve yourself.  Therefore, she dreams of going back to school and that this will make greater opportunities available so that she can decide upon a better job.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers and to pay for the labor to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some crockery and fresh food items for her husband's restaurant business

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is the age of 34, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been constructing houses and buildings for the last ten years. He is very expert in his art; he has constructed a lot of beautiful buildings in his career. He uses tools such as a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, chisel and level, which have been wearing out. Her wants to buy new tools and a grinder machine to continue his mason work but he does not have cash on hand. 

Therefore, Fouzia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband could be empowered to buy tools and a grinder machine for mason work.

Fouzia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's mason work

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: Todos los días María debe despertar desde muy temprano para preparar a sus dos hijos de 17 y 8 años de edad para que estudien ya que ella siempre sueña con ver que se superen, y es junto a ellos y su compañero de vida que vive en vivienda propia. Después de mandar a sus hijos a la escuela pública, inicia su jornada de trabajo para preparar los ingredientes que utilizara en la elaboración de panes con pollo  y tortas con jamón, las cuales vende con vecinos y conocidos desde hace 5 años. María adquirió anteriormente un crédito el cual utilizo para construir un cuarto para su hijo mayor, ya que sentía que su vivienda era muy pequeña, por lo que de nueva cuenta solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en cemento y arena para mejorar el cuarto que construyo con el crédito anterior, por lo que espera poder contar con este apoyo y de esta manera ver cumplido su sueño.
texts.en: Everyday Maria wakes up very early to prepare her children ages 17 and 8 years old, so that they can study. She always dreams to see them get ahead, and it is with them and her partner that they live in their own house. After sending her children to the public school, she starts her workday preparing the ingredients needed to make chicken and ham sandwiches, which she has been selling to her neighbors and acquaintances for the past 5 years. Maria previously received a loan used to build a room for her older son, because she felt that her house was very small. Thus now she is asking for a loan to FUSAI to purchase cement and sand to improve the room built with the previous loan. She hopes to obtain this support and this way she will achieve her dream.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand to improve the room she built with the previous loan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add onto her stock for more income gain to improve her family's living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase stock of various makes of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming by leasing more land and purchasing certified seeds, as well as modern farming equipment.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola, contando con herramientas propias de trabajo, con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, brinda este servicio en el distrito de Oyotún y distritos cercanos. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más herramientas de trabajo así como para brindar mantenimiento a sus actuales herramientas, con esto el espera brindar un mejor servicio lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Emilio, age 36, is in a common-law marriage.  He lives with his family in the Oyotún district.  It is a rural area where life is peaceful and the inhabitants work in agriculture and with livestock.  It is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He provides his services as an agricultural day worker.  He has his own work tools and over three years of experience in the business.  He provides this service in the Oyotún district and other districts that are nearby.

He is requesting the loan to buy more work tools and to provide maintenance on the tools that he has.  With this he hopes to provide better service, which will generate greater income.  Then he will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more work tools and to provide maintenance on the tools that he has.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary is 42 years old and married to Jane. He supports eight family members. He has been supplying charcoal for the last 15 years, and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Zachary has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a transporting mechanism for more income gain. He plans to use anticipated profit to repay the loan and be a large-scale farmer. 

His future hopes and dreams are to lead in charcoal supply in the area.

loans.use: to purchase a transporting mechanism for more income gain.

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.es:
José es un joven de 23 años de edad, lamentablemente solo pudo estudiar hasta 7° grado debido a que debe trabajar para salir adelante con su familia,   ahora está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José trabaja como jornalero desde hace muchos años, pero a lo que más se dedica actualmente es a la albañilería, también en sus tiempos libres él realiza cultivos de frijol y maíz, sus cosechas las vende y a si puede sacar ingresos económicos para poder sostener a su familia,  José trabaja de lunes a sábado en los horarios de 7:00 de la mañana a 3:00 de la tarde.

Este joven emprendedor necesita este crédito para preparar la tierra, comprar abono, insecticidas,  fertilizantes y algunas herramientas para llevar a cabo la siembra de maíz y frijol.

Sus sueños son continuar con sus estudios pues hoy en día es fundamental estar preparado para superarse, además desea comprar su propia casa y tener algo que ofrecer cuando decidan tener hijos con su esposa.
texts.en:
José is a young 23-year-old man. Unfortunately, he was only able to attend school until grade seven because he has to work to help his family. He is now married, and his wife does the housework.
José has worked as a day labourer for many years, but currently his work as a bricklayer takes up the most of his time. In his free time, he cultivates corn and beans. He sells his harvest to obtain an income for his family. José works Monday to Saturday from 7 am to 3 pm.
This young enterprising man needs a loan to prepare the land. He will purchase manure, insecticides, fertilizers, and some tools to realize his crop of corn and beans.
His dreams are to continue with his studies; these days, this is fundamental for success. He also wants to buy his own home and have something to offer his children when he and his wife decide to start their family.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides, fertilizer and some tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Sultana's husband buy a new rickshaw to continue supplying transportation services.

loans.name: Irfana

texts.en:
Irfana is a 32-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She does embroidery by hand at home and is financially supporting her family.

She belongs to a poor family.  Her husband’s income is very poor so she decided to start embroidery work at home. She has been learning these arts since childhood and is now using them as her occupation. This has enabled her to be independent and earn sufficient income. 

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase thread, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors. 

She hopes this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Irfana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase thread, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors for her embroidery work.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 27-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband and two kids in a small house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where his income is low and unstable. His income barely covers the family’s needs. Alaa took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water for the family’s house. This will help her provide hot water without buying electricity.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family's house.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en: Aysha is a 28-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband and two kids in a small house. Her husband works as a farmer, and his income is low and unstable. His income barely covers the family’s needs. Aysha took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help her to provide hot water without buying electricity.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family's house.

loans.name: Anorboi

texts.en: Anorboi is a hardworking man. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1961. He is divorced and has one child. They live in a rural area. Anorboi has been a farmer for 30 years. He also drives a taxi and has permanent clients. He knows farming well. Unfortunately the season was bad last year, and he did not have a harvest. He is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to buy fertilizer and corn. He awaits your kindness and hopes to have a good harvest next season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming by employing modern farming methods to increase productivity

loans.name: Elías Isaí

texts.es:
Elías de 32 años de edad, estudió nivel superior en la universidad, está soltero  y vive junto a sus padres y 3 hermanos pero solamente sus padres dependen de él.

Elías trabaja de profesor en una escuela de educación básica, tiene  cuatro años  en ese lugar, su trabajo le ha ayudado mucho a sacar adelante a su familia, su horario es de lunes a viernes de 7:30 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde y se transporta en motocicleta, además siempre que puede él realiza trabajos agrícolas de modo que no le falten ingresos económicos.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes, y algunas herramientas para la siembra de maíz.

Sus planes son continuar estudiando y sacar otra carrera universitaria, también espera construir su propia casa y casarse para formar una familia.
texts.en:
Elías, age 32, has some university education. He is single and lives with his parents and three siblings. His parents alone depend on him.
He works as a teacher in an elementary school. He has been doing this for four years, and it helps him greatly to support his family. He works Monday to Friday from 7:30 am to 4:00 pm. He gets there on motorcycle. Whenever he can, he also does farm work so that they are never lacking for income.
He needs this loan to purchase manure, insecticides, fertilizers, and some tools for planting corn.
His plans are to continue with his studies and get another university degree. He also hopes to build his own home and get married to start a family.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides, fertilizer and some tools.

loans.name: Jose Vladimir

texts.es:
José, de 36 años de edad, está acompañado y su pareja es comerciante de ropa, tiene dos hijos que viven en casa con él. 

José, es albañil y tiene 8 años de dedicarse a eso, todo lo aprendió gracias a un tío, que le inculcó desde pequeño el trabajo.- También se dedica a trabajar en las estructuras metálicas.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar bloques, cemento y hierro para construir el cuarto de la cocina.

Él sueña con poder mejorar poco a poco su vivienda y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José, age 36 is married. His wife sells clothing. They have two children who live in their home with them.
Jose has been a bricklayer for 8 years. He learned everything from an uncle who included him in his work from a young age. Jose also works with metal structures.
He needs this loan to buy blocks, cement, and iron to build a kitchen.
He dreams of being able to improve his home bit by bit, in order to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, and iron to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Shehzadi

texts.en: Shehzadi, 50, lives in Lahore with her family, including five children. Her son has been running a barber shop for many years. He has been using his hair salon tools for many years, but they are worn out and need to be replaced. His financial condition does not allow him to buy new instruments. Shehzadi applied for a loan so that her son can become empowered, and he can easily buy new instruments such as scissors, combs, a shaving machine, a front mirror and a revolving chair. Shehzadi hopes that this loan will work positively, and she will be able to save some money on her household expenses. Shehzadi thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy  to buy new tools for her son's hair salon business.

loans.name: Supriyono

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Supriyono. Supriyono lives in Pekalongan, a city located in Central Java, about two hours from Jakarta by plane. He lives there with his wife and his two daughters. 

Supriyono owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks and provides mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Supriyono needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his community. Supriyono’s goal toward Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Supriyono is the one who is standing in front of his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc.) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es:
Mario, de 37 años de edad, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al comercio de frutas, tiene 3 hijos, los cuales están estudiando.

Mario, trabaja de albañil desde hace 10 años, pero también es agricultor, cultiva maíz, frijol y café.- El trabajo lo aprendió gracias a su padre que desde pequeño le inculcó el trabajo. 

El crédito lo invertirá para comprar una novilla, para engordarla y venderla.

Mario, siempre ha soñado con comprar un vehículo.
texts.en:
Mario, age 37, is married. His wife sells fruit. They have three children, all of whom are in school.
Mario has worked as a bricklayer for ten years, but also as a farmer. He cultivates corn, beans, and coffee. He learned this work from his father, who included him in his work from a young age.
Mario will invest this loan on the purchase of a heifer to fatten and re-sell.
He has always dreamed of buying a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old and the single mother of the little baby you see in the picture. Ana lives at her parents' house and helps them with the home expenses.  

She looks after a library located at her home and needs a loan to buy more products for this business. Ana is a very hardworking woman. She has to take care of her baby almost all the time because her mother works too. 

Ana hopes to be able to hire a maid to babysit her baby and would also like to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business.

loans.name: Herta

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Herta. Herta lives in Lumajang, located approximately 150 km southeast of Surabaya, the capital city of East Java, Indonesia. Herta owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to her community. She knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive coming to her stall, and she decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn about how to expand her business in technology. As a woman, Sumarni realized that she has to help her husband to improve their life. Her community sees her as a trusted and cheerful mobile provider.

As the business grows, she needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Herta’s goal toward Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Herta is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Filadelfo Antonio

texts.es:
Filadelfo tiene 60 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene seis hijos de los cuales solamente dos viven en su casa, de él dependen cuatro personas; sus dos hijos su esposa y un nieto que tiene  a cargo.

Filadelfo se dedica a la agricultura, desde que era pequeño su padre le enseñó a trabajar y poco a poco aprendió este oficio, ahora puede trabajar para poder sostener a su familia, él siembra maíz y frijol y también  hortalizas como pepino, tomates y rábano, gracias a los cultivos él puede obtener ingresos económicos y así poder sostener a su familia. 

Él solicita este préstamo para comprar 3 sacos de abono y pagar mano de obra para para el cultivo de maíz y frijol.

Sus planes son mejorar sus cultivos, preparar mejor la tierra para que crezcan libres de plagas, ayudarles a sus hijos con sus estudios y que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Filadelfo is 60 and was in school until grade three. He is married, and his wife does the housework. They have six children, only two of whom live with them. Four people depend on him: his two children, his wife, and a grandchild they care for.
Filadelfo is a farmer. His father taught him this work from a young age, and he learned it bit by bit. He now farms to support his family. He cultivates corn and beans as well as vegetables like cucumber, tomato, and radish. Thanks to his crops, he is able to obtain an income to sustain his family.
He is requesting this loan for the purchase of three bags of manure and to pay the labourers to cultivate corn and beans.
His plans are to improve his crops, to prepare the land better so that there are no pests, and to help his children in their studies so they can succeed.

loans.use: to buy three bags of manure and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor, tiene 44 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos, reside en una aldea de la comunidad de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos. Lleva 8 años de cultivar café, el cual vende en húmedo en la zona de mercado. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y pago de limpieza de la finca de café con el fin de mejorar las condiciones del café. Su plan es seguir trabajando con el cultivo para mejorar las condiciones de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Victor, age 44, is in a common-law marriage.  He lives with his life partner and their two children in a village in the Nueva Frontera community in Santa Bárbara.  He has always worked in agriculture growing basic grains.  He has been growing coffee for eight years.  He sells it wet in the market area.

He is requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer and to pay to clear the fields of his coffee farm in order to improve the quality of the coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay to clear the fields of his coffee farm.

loans.name: Susilo

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Susilo. Susilo lives in Lumajang, located approximately 150 km southeast of Surabaya, the capital city of East Java, Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his three children. He knew Ruma from a Ruma’s sales executive coming to his stall, and he decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to expand his business in technology. 

Right now, Susilo is becoming a mobile airtime credits and bill payment services provider for his community. He feels happy because by becoming a Ruma agent, he can give social impact to his community that needs access to such services. His community sees him as a trusted and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, he needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Susilo’s goal toward Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Susilo is the one who is standing and holding Ruma's banner, together with his wife. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
Senhora Luisa tem 39 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 1 filha que actualmente não está a estudar, é negociante, vive em casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua neta.
 O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de mantas, duvetes, cortinas, no pais vizinho para revender no mercado local e assim ajudar o seu marido a custear as despesas da casa.
No futuro pretende abrir uma loja de venda de mobília visto que o marido é carpinteiro e estufador, tem plano de abrir uma oficina própria de fabrico de mobílias. O seu maior desafio e de adquirir uma viatura para ajudar no transporte produtos, e pessoal, assim como liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora
texts.en: Luisa is a 39 year old married mother with one daughter who is not currently attending school. She is a business woman who lives in her own home with her family and she also supports her grand-daughter. She plans to use the loan to buy sheets, duvets and curtains from the neighbouring country so that she can resell these in the local market as a means to helping her husband to cover the household expenses. In the future, she plans to open a shop selling furniture as her husband is a carpenter and an upholsterer who plans to establish his own furniture manufacturing business. The greatest challenge that she faces is in relation to buying a vehicle to assist in transporting their products and, on a personal level, to repaying her loan without getting into arrears.

loans.use: to buy sheets, duvets and curtains from the neighbouring country to resell on the local market so that she can help her husband to cover the household expenses.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 40 years old and married with 6 children, all of whom go to school.

He sells dry beans as his main source of income in Kasese-Uganda. He also gets additional income from rearing pigs and earning a monthly salary. He is faced with the challenge of market competition. Pascal wants money to purchase dry beans to sell.

He dreams of having an educated family in future.

loans.use: to purchase dry beans to sell.

loans.name: Dewi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Dewi. Dewi lives in Bekasi, the satellite city located at the east of Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and their three children (one daughter and two sons). She learned about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to her house. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn about how to start a business. As a woman, Dewi realizes that she has to help her husband to improve their life.  

For now, Dewi is becoming an agent who sells mobile airtime credits for her community. As the business grows, she needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Dewi’s goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

In the photo, Dewi is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication by selling mobile airtime credits

loans.name: Otara

texts.en:
Otara is 47 years old and he supports a family of four members. He has been in a motorcycle-transport service for the last 13 years, which earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle so as to provide better transport services to clients and meet their demands. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children to higher levels of education. 

His hope is to be financially stable and be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan is married. She has three adult children and grandchildren.  

For 25 years, she has been selling homemade Turkish ravioli, pita breads, tomato paste, tomato juice and jams.  At first, she sold to her neighbours but then she began getting lots of orders because her products were delicious and loved by everyone.  With her second loan, she is planning to buy spices and ingredients to make dough.  In addition to her products, she is planning on selling spices on request to her customers.  

Her dream is to open a shop of her own and sell her products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Reyhan Hanım evli, yetişkin üç çocuğu ve torunları var.  Reyhan Hanım  yirmi beş senedir evde mantı, el yufkası, salça, domates suyu, reçel yapıp satıyor.  İlk önceleri çevresine satıyor, yaptığı ürünler beğenilince müşterileri artıyor, siparişler alıyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile baharat ve hamur malzemeleri alacak.  Yufka, mantı satışının yanına müşterilerinin isteği ile baharat satışını da ekleyecek.  Tek hayali bir dükkan açmak ve yaptığı el ürünlerini  burada satmak olduğunu belirtti.

loans.use: to purchase spices and ingredients to make dough.

loans.name: Jesus Adalberto

texts.es:
Jesús, de 43 años de edad, está casado y su pareja es comerciante, se dedica al comercio de granos básicos y tiene dos hijos, de los cuales dos estudian. 

Jesús, es empleado y tiene 6 años de trabajar en la misma empresa, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo viaja en bus y su pequeña ganadería la tiene en su casa.

Jesús, necesita el crédito para comprar cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos, con este préstamo mejorará su ganadería y percibirá mejores ingresos de las ventas.

Su sueño es, mejorar su casa para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos y a su esposa.
texts.en:
Jesús is 43 years old and married. His spouse is a merchant, she works in the basic grain business. He has two children who are studying. Jesús is an employee and has been working for the same company for 6 years. He also raises cattle and pigs. He travels by bus to get to his work and his small farm is at his house.

Jesús needs a loan to buy pigs to fatten and later sell them. With this loan he will improve his animal rearing and receive higher income from the sales. His dream is to make improvements on his house to provide better living conditions for his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and then sell.

loans.name: Elva Luz

texts.es: La vivienda de Elva es propia y en ella vive al lado de su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos un varón de 15 años y una niña de 10 años de edad  desde hace varios años. Elva siempre ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable y trabajadora, por lo que buscando la forma de obtener ingresos económicos sin descuidarse de sus hijos decidió prestar sus servicios domésticos, pero además elabora tamales de gallina los fines de semana, lo que le permite estar pendiente de sus hijos, ya que los apoya para que estudien. La vivienda de Elva está hecha de adobe, pero anteriormente solicito un crédito que le permitió mejorar la fachada de su vivienda instalando balcones, repellando las paredes y encemento el piso de su vivienda, pero ella después de la buena experiencia solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI el cual invertirá en cemento y arena para continuar repellando las paredes de su vivienda, para lo que espera contar con este apoyo nuevamente.
texts.en:
Elva's house is her own, She has lived there with her life companion and her two children, a 15 year old son and a 10 year old daughter for a number of years. Elva has always shown herself to be a responsible and hard-working person. She was looking for a way to obtain some economic income without neglecting her children so she decided to offer her domestics services. But she also makes chicken tamales on the weekend which allows her to watch over her children and help them with their studies.

Elva's house is made of abode and previously she requested a loan to improve the outside of her house installing grills, plastering the walls and cementing over the floors of her house. After this good experience she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI which she will invest in cement and sand to continue to plaster the walls of her house. So she hopes to be able to count on this support once again.

loans.use: to invest in cement and sand to continue plastering the walls of her house.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos de 61 años de edad, no sabe leer ni escribir pues no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ella es madre soltera de 10 hijos de los cuales todos 6 están acompañados y los demás están junto a ella en casa.


Santos  se dedica a los oficios domésticos, desde su infancia se dedica a este rubro el cual aprendió de su mamá, el trabajo que principalmente realiza es preparar y cocinar los alimentos para los niños en un centro educativo, además se dedica a la agricultura durante la temporada y sus hijos le ayudan pues también es para beneficio de ellos.


Ella necesita mucho la ayuda de este crédito para comprar abono orgánico, fertilizantes, preparar la tierra y pagar mano de obra para llevar a cabo la siembra de granos básicos.

Ella desea tener mucho bienestar para ella y su familia, seguir mejorado  su  vivienda, que sus hijos sean personas de bien y ver crecer a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Santos is 61 years old.  She does not know how to read or write because she did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She is a single mother of 10 children, 6 of whom are in committed relationships and the others are together with her at home. 

Santos makes a living doing housework.  Since childhood she has dedicated herself to this field of work, which she learned from her mother.  The work she mainly does is preparing and cooking food for the children at an education center.  In addition, she makes a living by farming during the season, and her children help since it is also for their benefit.

She greatly needs the help of this loan in order to buy manure and fertilizer, to prepare the land, and to pay for the labor to carry out the planting of basic grains.

Santos wishes for a comfortable life for herself and her family, to continue improving her home, for her children to become good people, and to see her grandchildren grow.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer, to prepare the land, and to pay for the labor to carry out the planting of basic grains.

loans.name: Phinah

texts.en: Phinah is 39 years old. She is now re-married with three children who all go to school. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She used the previous loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and pay for labor. She practices agriculture, growing crops such as ground nuts, maize, and  beans for selling and also is in the produce business, buying and selling dry agriculture products. Phinah started the business to earn a living. She is hard-working. However, weather changes and high transport costs due to poor roads hinders her business growth. Phinah intends to use the loan to buy dry ground nuts and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy dry ground nuts and beans for selling.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a 31-year-old married woman with three children who used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell. Eliza operates a clothing shop (textiles) as a main source of income with an aim of employing herself. Her dreams are educating her children and expanding her business. Her challenges are inflation, competition and lack of enough capital which hinder her business growth. 

Eliza is asking for a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Telesfora

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira junto a dos de sus hijos y un nieto. Toda su vida se ha dedicado  a la agricultura al cultivo de café y granos básicos. También ha realizado actividades en alfarerías donde hacen productos de barro.
Esta actividad agrícola ha sido su fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia. Y para mantenerla activa Ha solicitado otro préstamo a ODEF para comprar abonos  y fertilizar la parcela de café para poder sacar mejor producción y ganancias en la próxima cosecha. Ella tiene como plan seguir mejorando sus cultivos para mejorar su calidad de vida familiar y darles un patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en: María is a 56 year old single mother of 5 children. She lives in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira together with two of her children and a grandchild. She has worked all her life growing coffee and basic grains. She also makes thing with clay, producing pottery products. The agricultural activity has been her source of money to sustain her family and keep it active. She has requested another loan from ODEF to buy manure and fertilize her plot of coffee to be able to have better production and profits in the coming season. She has a plan of continuing to improve her crops to raise the family's quality of living and leave an inheritance for her children.

loans.use: to buy manure to fertilize her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is a 30-year-old female. She is married with 5 children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. For 4 years, Sylivia has been running a retail shop of general merchandise. She began the business to support her family and give her children a better future. Sylivia is a hard working woman with the dream of growing her business plus building a residential house for her family. However, she is faced with a challenge of limited capital to expand her business. Sylivia has asked for a loan to buy construction materials like timber and sand for her residential house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like timber and sand for her residential house.

loans.name: Marilia

texts.pt:
Senhora Marila tem 34 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 3 filhos dos quais um frequentando o ensino primário e outros no secundário, trabalha como auxiliar de contabilidade, vive em casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
 O montante do empréstimo irá aplicar para a compra de cimento, blocos, varões, estribos para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa
No futuro pretende continuar com os estudos, e construir dependências para acomodar os filhos, visto que agora dormem juntos e apertados num compartimento.
O seu maior desafio é de terminar o curso de contabilidade que esta fazendo e garantir melhor formação académica para os filhos assim como liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora.
texts.en: Marila is a 34 year old married mother to 3 children: 1 of whom attends primary school and the others are at secondary school. She works as an accounting assistant and she lives in her own home with her family; she does not support anyone else. She plans to use the loan to buy cement, building blocks and rods, and reinforcing steel links so that she can continue with building work on her home. In the future she plans to continue with her studies and to build outbuildings to accommodate her children, who currently sleep together in a very small space. The greatest challenges that she faces are finishing her course of study in accounting, ensuring that her children receive a good education and repaying her loan without getting into arrears.

loans.use: to buy cement, building blocks and rods and reinforcing steel links in order to continue with building work on her home.

loans.name: Müge

texts.en:
Müge is divorced and has two children, ages 15 and 12. She buys spices and sells them to her neighbors and friends. She buys spices in bulk and packages them as she likes and sells them. She has been earning her living this way for a year. She will be buying spices in bulk with the help of her second loan. She says she earns more profit if she buys in bulk. Later on, she plans to open a shop of her own and sell spices and natural products. She plans to ensure a better standard of living for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Müge Hanım eşinden boşanmış, on beş ve on iki yaşında iki çocuğu var.  Çeşitli baharatlar alıp, çevresine ve arkadaşlarına satıyor.  Baharatlarını toptan alıp isteğe göre kendi paketleyip satıyor.  Bir yıldır bu şekilde kendisine gelir sağlıyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile toplu şekilde baharat alacak.  Toplu alımlarda daha çok kar elde ettiğini söylüyor.  İleride kendi işini yapmak baharat ve doğal ürünler satacağı bir dükkanı olsun istiyor.  Daha iyi bir gelir elde ettiğinde çocuklarına daha iyi yaşam koşulları sağlayacağını düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy spices in bulk.

loans.name: Melahat

texts.en:
Melahat is a mother of two children.  Her husband is deceased and she lives with her 35-year-old daughter, who has health problems. Melahat is a housewife but she she wanted to get involved in some activities in order to clear her mind and have a nice time. She started selling cotton shirts, pants and underwear. She said that it felt good to be around people and it kept her from thinking about her problems. With her second loan, she is planning to buy bulk clothing for the summer before the season starts and increase the variety of her products. She says that everything is going well for now and she will keep on doing this as long as her and her daughter's health permit.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Melahat Hanım iki çocuk annesi.  Eşi vefat etmiş, otuz beş yaşında hasta kızı ile yaşıyor.  Ev hanımı ama kafasını dağıtmak bir şeylerle uğraşmak, kaliteli zaman geçirmek istediğinden bir şeyler yapmak istemiş.  Penye üst giyim,Keten pantolonlar, iç çamaşırı v.s satmaya başlamış.  Bu işin kendisini biraz olsun sorunlarından uzaklaştırdığını ve insanlarla ilişki içinde olmanın, uğraşmanın ona iyi geldiğini söyledi.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile yaz sezonuna girerken yazlık penyeler almayı düşünüyor, ürün çeşidini arttıracak ve toplu alış yapacağını belirtti.  Şimdilik işinin iyi gittiğini kendi sağlığı ve kızının durumu el verdikçe bu işi devam ettirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep is married and a mother of three. She runs a grocery store that she started 11 years ago to support her family. She is also a salesperson for Tupperware products. With her new loan, she is planning to purchase more Tupperware products to resell. She believes that this new loan will increase her sales. She wants to support her children through college. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Zeynep Hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Bakkal dükkanı ve tupperware ürün satışı yapıyor.  Evde boş oturmaktan sıkıldığından ve eşine ev ekonomisinde yardımcı olabilmek için mahallesinde küçük bir bakkal dükkanı açıp işletmeye başlıyor.  Onbir yıldır bakkal dükkanını işletiyor.  Tupperware ürünleri ile bir arkadaşın vasıtası ile tanışmış.  Üye olmuş hem kendine ürün almaya hem de çevresine satış yapmaya başlamış.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile tupperware(mutfak eşyaları) ürünleri alacak ,siparişlerini alacak.  Bu kredi ile satışının artacağını düşünüyor.  Çocuklarını üniversitede okutup birer meslek sahibi yapmayı düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware products.

loans.name: Emel

texts.en:
Emel is married. She worked with her father, who was a tradesperson. She needed to take care of her father after he got sick and had financial difficulties after his death. So she decided to work and began to sell many goods, including Tupperware products. She is currently a group leader for Tupperware.  With her second loan, she is going to purchase more Tupperware products to sell. Since she got married for the second time recently, her biggest desire is to live in peace. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Emel Hanım evli.  Çocuğu yok.  Babası ile uzun yıllar esnaflık yapıyor.  Babası hastalanınca ona bakmak zorunda kaldığından dükkanını kapatıyor.  Babasının vefatı ile ekonomik sebeplerden tekrar çalışmak zorunda kalıyor.  Bir çok ürünün doğrudan satışını yapmaya başlıyor.  Bunların içinde tupperware ürünleri de var.  Çok çeşit olunca hepsine yetişemediğinden  sadace tupperware ürünlerini satmaya başlıyor.  Şu an da tupperware de grup liderliği yapıyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile de tupperware (mutfak eşyalar)ürünleri alıp satacak.  Emel Hanım ikinci evliliğini yeni yaptığından hayatta mutlu ve huzurlu yaşamak tek istediği.

loans.use: to buy more Tupperware products to sell.

loans.name: Nebahat

texts.en:
Nebahat is a married mother of three. She prepares sweets with lavender wrapped in tulle for weddings and to celebrate new births. She began this work in order to contribute to her family's income. After making an agreement with one store in her neighborhood, she went to other stores selling such sweets and got more orders. Now, she is now making sweets both for her own future daughter-in-law and these stores. With her second loan she will grow her business by purchasing lavender and different colored tulle.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Nebahat  Hanım evli ve üç çocuk annesi.  Evde nikah şekeri bebek şekerlerine içlerine lavanta koyarak tül hazırlıyor.  Bu işe evde bir şeyler yaparak ailesine katkı sağlamak için başlamış.  Mahallesinde bulunan bir dükkanla anlaşmış.  Daha sonra  bu işi yapan dükkanları dolaşarak sipariş almış.  Şimdi hem gelinine hem de diğer dükkanlara iş yapıyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi  ile çeşitli renklerde tül ve lavanta alıp işini devam ettirecek

loans.use: to buy lavender.

loans.name: Kwagalana Development - Ndeeba Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a repeat client of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, having previously taken a loan of UGX 500,000. She is a married woman aged 35 years, She owns a food stall in order to support her household. This loan will help to increase on her working capital and expand on the business, She has applied for a loan of 500,000 through the group so that she can buy bunches of green bananas, Irish potatoes, cabbages and tomatoes to sell to her customers. She is however faced with challenges of competition and limited capital.

She is very grateful for the support from UGAFODE and Kiva lenders offered to her and the other group members since they are now able to fund their businesses.

The sixth person is the group chairperson who has taken a loan but has a different loan period. She signed a waiver form though.

loans.use: to buy food items for sell.

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.es:
Ciriaco tiene 69 años de edad, es una persona de avanzada edad pero muy trabajador, él está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, en su casa vive su hija, su yerno y dos nietos. 
		 
Ciriaco se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra granos básicos como maíz y frijol, desde que estaba pequeño sus padres le inculcaron a aprender a cultivar la tierra, además es ganadero, su yerno es quien le ayuda en los trabajos agrícolas y para llegar donde cultiva debe caminar 30 minutos.


  Este crédito le servirá a Ciriaco para comprar 5 sacos de abono orgánico, y pagar mano de obra para el cultivo de maíz y frijol.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante como agricultor y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Ciriaco is 69.  He is an older person but very hard working. He lives with his partner who takes care of household duties. His daughter, son-in-law and two grandchildren also live in his house.

Ciriaco is a farmer.  He grows basic grain crops such as corn and beans. Since he was little his parents taught him to cultivate the land.  He also raises livestock. His son-in-law is the who helps him with his farm work.  He has to walk 30 minutes to get to his cropland.

This loan will allow Ciriaco to buy 5 bags of organic compost and pay labor costs to grow corn and beans.

His dreams are to move forward as a farmer and improve his house.

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of organic compost and pay labor costs to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 64 años de edad, estudio solo hasta primer grado, ya que por no tener los recursos necesarios no pudo seguir sus estudios, es viuda, su esposo murió hace 11 años, tuvo 3 hijos, la mayor vive con ella en su casa y tres nietos, la segunda vive en E.E.U.U. y el menor está acompañado y vive en la ciudad.

María, desde pequeña se dedicó a vender tamales, su madre administraba el negocio y ella le apoyaba en la venta, de esta manera aprendió el negocio; luego cuando se independizo se dedicó a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado y actualmente tiene una tienda donde vende sodas, golosinas, refrescos, algunas verduras, carnes, entre otros. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar productos para surtir la tienda y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, esto mejorara su negocio.

Ella sueña con poder tener salud para poder seguir trabajando y ver a sus nietos superarse académica.
texts.en:
María, 64 years old, went to school only until first grade; she could not continue her studies because she didn’t have the necessary resources. She is a widow—her husband died 11 years ago. She had 3 children, and the oldest lives with her and 3 grandchildren; the second lives in USA, and the youngest is married and lives in the city.

María sold tamales since childhood. Her mother managed the business and she helped her sell the tamales, so she learned the business. Then, when she went off on her own she sold fruits and vegetables in the market and currently has a store where she sells sodas and other drinks, candy, some vegetables, meat, and other products.

She needs the loan to buy products to stock the store and meet the demand of her customers, which will improve her business.
She dreams of being able to maintain her health to keep working and see her grandchildren excel academically.

loans.use: to buy products to stock the store.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: This is Teresia. She is a student of International Business administration with a concentration in finance. She is the last born in her family and her mother is a single parent. Her mother is unable to raise school fees for her. Teresia dreams of becoming a finance manager and through the Kiva loan she shall be able to pay for her last semester in school.

loans.use: to pay for tuituion costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy men and women's clothing

loans.name: Agriana

texts.en:
A loan of $1,000 is offered to Agriana to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. She has a secondhand clothing business where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional inventory such as shorts, long pants, long sleeve and short sleeve shirts. 

Agriana has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Agriana independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shorts, long pants, long sleeve and short sleeve shirts

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is a 40-year-old married woman with two dependents ages 24 and 14. She engages in a sea cucumber vending business. She sells sea cucumber to the locals in her community.  Aside from that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities ranging form noodles, soft drinks, sugar, canned goods, seasonings and soap. Rosita has requested a loan to buy assorted items for her store, such as beverages, seasonings and assorted canned goods. These items will attract more buyers so that Rosita can increase her income for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy items for her store

loans.name: Muro De Bronce Group

texts.en:
Quetzaltenango is the second largest city in Guatemala, located in a valley surrounded by mountains in the Western Highlands of the country. The population of the area is mainly involved with agricultural and handicraft endeavors. There are also small factories that fabricate industrial products. Approximately 60% of the population is indigenous, with the predominate groups being “K’iche” and “Mam”.

Nine women have joined together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank "Muro de Bronce". Irma is the 55-year-old president of the group. She is married and has three children, all of whom are studying in the local university! Irma is an energetic woman and encourages the members of the Trust Bank to be on time to their meetings, to be attentive and to confidently participate. The group is requesting their very first loan that they hope will be funded by KIVA investors. Irma will use her funds to support her food business. She creates delicious dishes for breakfast, lunch and dinner. She also takes care of a boarder in her home and would like to purchase two additional beds and linens for them.

Irma and her friends in the Trust Bank meet monthly with a Friendship Bridge Loan Facilitator who presents participatory educational training for the women in their own indigenous language. Since many of the ladies have had little or no education, they are hungry for knowledge about hygiene, health, women’s rights and the use of medicinal plants. They are eager to gain information about successfully managing and growing their businesses, so subjects like accounting, budgeting, pricing, marketing and customer service are very useful to them. The ladies also learn how to manifest their dreams and set goals. Friendship Bridge calls the effective combination of education and small loans “Microcredit Plus".

Thank you, Kiva investors, for learning about Irma and her friends in the "Muro de Bronce” Trust Bank. They are poised to step into a brighter future, benefiting themselves, their families and their community outside of Quetzaltenango, Guatemala.

loans.use: To buy cooking supplies for her food business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 63 years old and widowed. For 40 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Gloria requested a 5000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy items to sell in her store such as canned goods, home care products, and groceries. In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mirna Aracely

texts.es:
Mirna de 30 años de edad, está casada y su esposo es albañil, tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos van a la escuela del cantón y el ultimo tiene 2 años por lo tanto aún no puede estudiar.

Actualmente, Mirna solo se dedica a cuidar a sus niños y a realizar los oficios del hogar, antes realizaba venta de pan el cual vendía en el mismo cantón, ella se levanta desde muy temprano a prepararles el desayuno a sus hijos para mandarlos a la escuela y luego continúa con los oficios del hogar.

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas, etc. para aplicarlos a su cultivo de maíz.

Ella espera administrar bien sus ganancias para que no les falte nada a sus hijos y además espera darles excelente educación.
texts.en:
Mirna is 30 years old. She is married and her husband is a mason. She has three children. Two of them are in the canton school, and the last one is 2 years old and cannot yet go to school. 

Currently, Mirna works taking care of her children and doing housework. Previously she sold bread in the same canton. She wakes very early to prepare breakfast for her children to send them to school and then continues with housework.

She needs this loan to purchase agricultural supplies like manure, fertilizers, insecticides, etc to apply to her corn crop. 

She hopes to manage her earnings so that her children don't lack anything. Additionally, she hopes to give them an excellent education.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies like manure, fertilizers, insecticides, etc to apply to her corn crop.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Senhora Amélia tem 58 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 3 filhos, dos quais 1 estuda frequentando o ensino primário, é negociante, vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de sacos vazios para revender na zona norte do pais, de modo a ajudar o seu marido a sustentar as despesas da casa.
No futuro pretende construir casa de banho moderna e comprar nova mobília para sua casa, e também gostaria de ampliar a sua casa visto que nos dias em que tem visitas o espaço fica insuficiente.
A insuficiência de fundos torna suas actividades muito lentas, assim sendo vai fazer sempre empréstimos para crescer os seus projectos pessoais.
texts.en: Amelia is a 58 year old married mother to 3 children, 1 of whom attends primary school. She is a business woman and she lives in her own home with her family. She plans to use this loan to buy empty sacks to resell in the north of the country as a means to helping her husband to cover the household expenses. In the future she hopes to build a modern bathroom and buy new furniture for her home. She would also like to extend her house as whenever she visitors, she is always short of space. Her lack of money means that these activities progress very slowly and, consequently, she plans to apply for further loans in order to continue with her personal projects.

loans.use: to buy empty sacks to resell in the north of the country.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 42-year-old married  man from Jabalia city. He lives with his wife and three kids in a small house. He works as a teacher in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covera all the family needs. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house; this will help him to provide hot water without using electricity. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en: Raeda, 32, is a married woman without children. Her husband works as a taxi driver with low wages. Raeda started her own business to help her husband provide household income. Her business is a small beauty salon for women that she opened after she gained experience working in another salon. Now she is asking for a loan to buy more supplies for the salon including products such as perfumes and cosmetics to sell. These supplies will allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Dora

texts.pt:
Senhora Dora tem 55 anos de idade, é viúva, mãe de 2 filhos dos quais sustenta 1 frequentando ensino médio profissional em mecânica geral, é professora, vive em casa própria com o seu filho.
O valor financiado irá aplicar para a compra de aros de janelas, portas, cimento para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir a construção da sua casa para garantir a comodidade da sua família, visto que agora partilha o mesmo quarto  para dormir com os filhos.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos para lograr os seus projectos, e uma vez que é viúva luta bastante para garantir o sustento escolar do filho.
texts.en: Dora is a 55 year old widowed mother to 2 children. She is still supporting one of her children who attends college and is studying general mechanics. She is a teacher and she lives in her own home with her son. She plans to use this loan to buy window frames, doors and cement so that she can continue with building work on her home. In the future, she hopes to finish the building work so that she can ensure that her family are comfortable as she currently shares her sleeping quarters with her children. The greatest challenge that she faces is repaying the loan without getting into arrears so that she can apply for further loans with which to complete her projects and, as a widow, she has to work hard to ensure that her son can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to buy window frames, doors and cement in order to continue with building work on her home.

loans.name: Uldona

texts.ru: Улдона из города Душанбе. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Улдона спокойная женщина. Она работает уборщицей в библиотеки университета. Она занимается этой деятельности уже 3.5 года. Ее старшая дочка тоже работает  уборщицей в университете. Муж занимается ремонтом домов. Он хороший мастер. Сейчас Улдона болеет, ей надо лечиться. Но для купли лекарство для здоровья у нее нет денежных средств, и по той причине Улдона просит кредит.  Ей очень важно ее здоровья. Вы можете помочь ей с финансовыми трудностями.
texts.en:
Uldona is from the city of Dushanbe.  She is 46 years old.  She is married and the mother of three children.  She is a quiet woman who has been working as a cleaning lady at the university library for three and a half years.  Her oldest daughter also works as a cleaning lady at the university.  Her husband repairs houses.  He is a good craftsman.

Uldona is currently sick and she needs treatment.  However, she doesn't have the financial resources to buy medications to get better.  For this reason, she is taking a loan.  Her health is very important to her.  Please help her through this difficult financial situation.

loans.use: to buy medications for her treatment.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan improved her clothing business. She was able to buy a variety of clothes needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family’s daily needs.

She is very positive that she can improve her business if you will lend her an amount of 25,000 PHP. This new loan will go towards additional supplies of clothing items she needs for her business. Her customers will buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result to a significant increase in profits, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she will be able to sustain the needs of her family.

Susan wants to increase her clothing products so that she can offer more choices to her customers. She dreams for her children to finish their schooling. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready-to-wear merchandise like dresses, polo shirts for men and women, socks, and shirts to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic household commodities like beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, flour, eggs, cooking oil and many others. She is a married woman with five children ages 18-6 year old. Her husband earns a living and works as a salesman.

Evelyn is asking for a loan to buy an assorted variety of soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries.  These will enhance the content of her store. Thus, it will augment her earnings and she will be able to handle her business. With this, she could now provide her family with nutritious diets and better living conditions.

Evelyn is hopeful to expand her business and manage it properly to continue to finance the schooling of her children for a brighter future.
