loans.use: to buy an assorted variety of soft drinks , canned goods and other groceries

loans.name: Herlina

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Herlina. Herlina lives in North Bogor, located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her child. Herlina owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to her community. This is the second time that she is asking for a loan from Kiva and she thanks all of the lenders because of it. She decided to join Ruma because she heard that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as an informative and kind mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Herlina needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Herlina’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Mapan, Ruma’s latest product. As seen in the photo, Herlina is the one who is standing in front of her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits

loans.name: Yati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! It’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Yati. Yati lives in Bekasi, a satellite city located in the east of Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her only daughter. Yati owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she heard that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as an informative mobile provider. As a woman, Yati realized that she has to help her husband increase their income, that's why she become an agent for Ruma. 

As the business grows, Yati needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Yati’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Yati is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an 8m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a business in her house selling buffalo. She is making a good income from selling, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy every day.

And she is happy with this loan because it will be improving her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Guzal

texts.en: Guzal is a cheerful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1985. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has three children. Guzal is a bright, honest, and kind person. She was interested in improving her capability and work experience. She participated in a three day training program provided by IMON to its clients. She got basic information about how to start a business from this “Women entrepreneur – achieve success” training. After this, she decided to open her own business by buying and selling perfume and perfumery products. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy the initial goods to open her business. She awaits your kindness and hopes that she will have a good business.

loans.use: to buy initial goods like perfume products to open her business

loans.name: Vilma Angelica

texts.es:
Vilma de 45 años de edad, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en calles con proyectos de mejoramiento y construcción de caminos, tiene 6 hijos y es por ellos que se esfuerza día a día para ayudarles a superarse, ya que 5 están en la escuela y uno estudia en la universidad. 

Desde muy pequeña, Vilma se ha dedicado a diferentes actividades productivas que le generan ingresos económicos, pero a lo que más se dedica es a la elaboración de pan, ella se levanta muy temprano a preparar el desayuno a sus hijos para llevarlos a la escuela y después continuar con sus actividades diarias.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar ganado bovino para criarlos y luego comercializarlos.

Sus sueños son ver a su hijo mayor graduarse de la universidad, que sus hijos menores también logren ser profesionales y tener una casa digna para vivir su vejez.
texts.en:
Vilma, 45, is married, and her husband works improving and building roads. They have 6 children, and they are the reason that she strives every day to help them better themselves, as 5 of them are in school and one is studying at university.

Since she was very young, Vilma has worked in different productive activities that provide an income, but what she does most is making bread. She gets up very early in order to prepare breakfast for her children and take them to school. She then continues with her daily activities.

Vilma needs this loan in order to buy cattle to raise and then sell. Her dream is to see her eldest son graduate from university, and that her younger sons will manage to be professionals, and to have a decent house to live in in her old age.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Reissig

texts.es: Reissig tiene una vivienda la cual alquila como fuente de ingreso , necesita hacerle varias mejoras. Está solicitando un crédito por  $500 , con lo cual comprará baldosas para el piso, un tanque de reserva de agua y una nueva puerta entre otros materiales. Reissig pretende mejorar las condiciones de vivienda e incrementar el alquiler de la misma.
texts.en:
Reissig has a house which he rents out to provide an income, and he needs to make several improvements. He is asking for a loan of $500, which he will use to buy floor tiles, a water reserve tank, and a new door, among other materials. 

Reissig wants to improve the living conditions and so increase the rent of the house.

loans.use: improve his rental property.

loans.name: Dalys Georgina

texts.es: Dalys es dueña de una sala de belleza, de los ingresos obtenidos de esta actividad depende tanto ella como su hijo . Ella quiere mejorar sus servicios y aumentar su clientela, por lo que solicita un crédito por $250, con este dinero  comprará productos de belleza para el consumo del salón y por supuesto aspira a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dalys owns a beauty salon. She and her son depend on the income she earns from the salon. She wants to improve her services and increase the number of clients. 

This is why she is asking for a loan of $250, which she will use to buy beauty products for the salon, and of course she hopes to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell and use in her salon.

loans.name: Savri

texts.en: Savri is a capable woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1959. She is living in a remote district with a big population. She is married and has two children. For about ten years, she has practised doing business in agriculture. She keeps livestock and her husband does agricultural plantings. They help and support each other in their activities. She likes to keep livestock and is interested in helping more to plant agricultural products. She wishes to plant and have a good harvest from it. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer and seeds. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! It’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Abu. Abu lives in East Serang, a suburban area located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his only son. Abu owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services (like electricity, water, etc) to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he heard that Ruma has the best service and system. his community sees him as a trusted and informative mobile provider. Abu feels happy because ever since he joined Ruma, he can contribute more  to his community.

As the business grows, Abu needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Abu’s goal in the near future is to start an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Abu is the one who is standing, together with his wife and his son. He is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services

loans.name: Chunima Group

texts.en:
Two of the goals of Friendship Bridge are to help women unlock their potential and to create long-­term, transformational change. The Microcredit Plus Program of the organization, which effectively combines small loans and education, provides over 22,000 women the ability to do this.

Nine women, dressed in the traditional “traje” or outfit of the area, have joined together in the rural community of Chunimá in Chichicastenango to form  the Trust Bank “Chunima”. They have just finished their second loan cycle and are requesting a third loan that they hope will be funded by Kiva investors. The women are quite pleased that they have been able to expand their small businesses and look forward to continuing to do so.

María is a 66-year-old married member of the Trust Bank who has one son. She has four businesses that include a convenience store, a shop that sells masa to make corn tortillas and tamales, a traditional textile business (traditional blouses called “huipiles”, woven belts and napkins) as well as an animal husbandry business (chickens, turkeys, goats). She sells her traditional textiles and animals in the large and well-­known market in Chichicastenango. With her third loan, Maria plans to purchase items for her convenience store like salt, sugar, chiles, fruits and vegetables as well as laundry and bath soap. She also wants to buy five pounds of good quality thread and fabric for her textile business. 

Doña María enthusiastically shares that she really likes to participate in the educational parts of the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank. A Friendship Bridge Facilitator creatively presents training on a variety of useful and relevant subjects like effective business management practices (accounting, budgeting, pricing, marketing, customer service), personal care (health, hygiene, use of medicinal plants), and empowerment (self-esteem, women’s  rights). Friendship Bridge calls the effective combination of education and small loans “Microcredit Plus”. It allows for more dependable cash flow, increased productivity, increased sales and higher income.

Kiva investors are valued partners with Friendship Bridge in this effort. Thank you for your generosity and kindness!

loans.use: to purchase items for her convenience  store like salt, sugar, chiles, fruits and vegetables as well as laundry and bath soap

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: Zuhro is a talented woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She lives in a small village that is the best place for agriculture. She is married and has two children. Zuhro has been doing business in agriculture for many years. She rents a yard where she plants cereal and corn. Separately, she keeps livestock and feeds them for selling at the animal market. She knows her activity well and likes to have a business in agriculture. She is asking for financial support to buy fertilizer, corn, and cereal, and to pay for the technical services of rental employees and rented land. She hopes to have a good harvest in the coming season and to earn some benefit from her activity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn, and cereal, and to pay for the technical services of rental employees and rented land

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar is a brave woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1979. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a master of construction and works with orders. 

About six years she started a business keeping livestock at home and selling them in the animal market. She well knows her activity and recently has sold two livestock. She wants to enlarge her business by further opening a farm. 

Her house is old and needs to be renovated, or it will collapse.. She appealed to IMON asking for a loan for the renovation of her house. 

She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and wishes to have a better condition to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house, which is in danger of collapsing

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: Dilafruz is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She lives in a small village with beautiful, fresh nature and with flowers blossoming in the spring season. It is most common in these places to keep livestock and do agriculture. Dilafruz is married and has three children. She has worked in agriculture for about 15 years. She is planting onions, tomatoes, and cucumbers in her yard. She knows her activity well and cares about her products (harvest). She is planning to ask for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy onion, tomato, and cucumber seeds. The plantings will give her a good harvest for the next season. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support an agrarian woman in Tajikistan.

loans.use: to buy onion, tomato, and cucumber seeds

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 46-year-old married woman and mother of five children. Her youngest child is 13 year old.  She operates a sari-sari(variety) store, selling various good such as bread, biscuits, fruit flavored juices, noodles, canned goods, and  toiletries.

She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, charcoal, and hard drinks. These will help Ma. Gina improve the inventory of her store and increase her profits.  In this way, she can provide a nutritious diet and better shelter for her children.

She is doing her best to expand and handle her business properly to be able to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, charcoal, and hard drinks

loans.name: Betzy Zulema

texts.es: Betzy es dueña de un Restaurante, el cual ha tenido por varios años, sin embargo ya necesita de mejoras en su estructura como cambio de piso entre otras, lo que considera necesario para brindar un mejor servicio a sus cliente, por esta razón está solicitando un préstamo por $ 500, dinero con el cual comprarán los materiales necesarios para realizar este trabajo.
texts.en:
Betzy owns a restaurant, which she has had for several years. However she needs to make improvements to the structure such as changing the floor, among other things. 

Betzy believes this is necessary in order to offer a better service to her customers, and this is why she is asking for a loan of $500. She will use the money o buy the necessary materials to carry out the work.

loans.use: buy materials to change the floor of her restaurant.

loans.name: Moni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! It’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Moni. Moni lives in Bogor, located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband. She joined Ruma since 2013 and this is the second time she is asking for a loan from Kiva. As a woman, she wanted to join Ruma in order to help her husband improve their life and learn about how to start up a business, as well as give more contribution to her community. 

As the business keeps growing, Moni is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be important for Moni to improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Moni is the one who is standing and holding Ruma's banner. She is thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales

loans.name: Nehad

texts.en:
Nehad is a 26-years-old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband and one son in a small house. Her husband works as a taxi driver where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely enough to cover all of the family's needs.

Nehad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar energy system for heating water for the family's house. This will help her to provide hot water without using electricity.

Nehad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie engages in a food vending business.  She prepares meals at home, like pansit( noodles) and snack food, like banana cue (deep fried banana). She is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, ages 10-8 months old respectively. She has been engaged in her food vending business for 5 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies for food vending. These will enable Lelanie to prepare a variety of meals to sell. Thus, it will augment her income and she will be able to provide her family with nutritious diets. 

Lelanie would like to expand her food vending business to finance the schooling of her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food vending like pansit( noodles), seasonings, banana and other supplies

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a skillful woman. She was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1969. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is a widow and has two children. It is not easy to raise her children alone. 

She is a cook and works at a café. She has many years experience in this field. Now she is the chief cooker at the café. 

The family has some difficulties with finances, so Matluba and her son decided to buy a ticket to Russia for him to find a job. 

She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan for purchase of a ticket for her son, in order that he may earn an additional income for their family. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to buy a ticket to Russia for her son, in order that he will provide an additional income for their family

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es: Margarita  y su esposo hace 10 años lograron construir su vivienda en un terreno que compraron con mucho esfuerzo y en el cual viven junto a sus 2 hijos de 19 y 16 años de edad. Aprovechando la demanda de uniformes escolares Margarita inicio su pequeño negocio de elaboración y venta de los mismos, la cual realiza en su vivienda desde hace 6 años, lo que le permite  apoyar  a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Margarita siempre buscando la forma de mejorar su calidad de vida por medio de sus ingresos económicos ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: telas, hilos, agujas, botones y broches para continuar mejorando su negocio, esperando percibir mejores ingresos económicos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita and her husband were able to build their home 10 years ago in a land they purchase with a lot of effort. They live with their two sons, 19 and 16 years old. Taking advantage of the demand for school uniforms, Margarita started her own small business. She makes and sells them and has been doing this from her home for 6 years now. This allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.  

Margarita who is always looking for ways of improving the quality of life by generating income, decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in: fabric, threads, needles, buttons and clasps to continue to improve her business. She hopes to generate better revenue to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in: fabrics, threads, needles, buttons and clasps to continue to improve her business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Doña Maritza es una mujer indígena Ngobe, con experiencia en ventas de mercancía seca (ropa, papelería, útiles escolares, zapatos, entre otros), ella tiene un  almacén donde vende todos estos artículos, necesita surtir su negocio, además quiere diversificar las ventas y generar mayores ingresos para ella y su familia, formada por su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad. Está solicitando $2.100 con lo cual pretende lograr un crecimiento en su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Maritza is a Ngobe indigenous woman, with experience selling dry goods (clothes, stationery, school supplies, shoes etc.). She has a general store where she sells all of these goods, and she needs to stock her business. 

She also wants to expand her sales and increase the income she gets for herself and her family, which is made up of her husband and three children. She is asking for $2100 which she will use to grow her business.

loans.use: buy goods at wholesale to stock her store.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a long-term client of the institution who is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX. Lawrence is 58 years old, married, and has eight children. He is a resident of Kicence, Rwentondo, Eastern Div Rukungiri Municipality. Lawrence runs a hotel in the municipality. In addition, he is involved in farming where he grows matoke and rears cows and goats. His main challenge has been limited capital to inject into those agricultural projects. He hopes that with this loan, he will be able to buy more cows and goats. This will provide more manure for his banana plantation and lead to increased income from both animals and plants. These increased incomes will increase his sustainability and growth.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Shyqyri

texts.en:
This is Shyqyri, a 28-year-old married man and a father to two daughters shown in the photograph.  They are Egyptian Albanians and they live in a little town in northern Albania. 

They live in a one-room family home with no toilet or kitchen.  The home's roof is made of metal sheets and as such it makes the room very cold in the winter and extremely hot during summer months. “My kids are sleeping here and I am worried about them as they have developed lots of illnesses in this short time since they were born. I want to cover this room with a proper roof and I need some financial help,” said Shyqyri showing the inside of the room to the loan officer.

Shyqyri has been working for about 7 years now in a warehouse for a monthly pay of $350, and also plants some veggies and grains for their use. He’s got about 1000 meters of land and a goat and 15 chickens. Even though he receives a salary, his family’s living condition falls below the national poverty line.

loans.use: to pay for material and costs of building a proper roof for his family's home

loans.name: Cerro Labor Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Cerro Labor” is beginning their third loan cycle with Friendship Bridge, and the eleven ladies are quite happy that they can continue to support their small businesses and help their husbands meet their household expenses. The women have learned a lot from their monthly educational training and have been able to use the tools that they have gained in their personal and business lives.

Berta is a hardworking 24-year-old member of the Trust Bank with three children. She strives to set a good example for the rest of the group and is happy to help her husband support the needs of their family. With her loan, Berta would like to purchase a variety of animals like chickens, pigs and sheep as well as their feed.

The women of the Trust Bank are aware of how very important education is for themselves and their children. Berta, along with the members of the group, learn about the world within them and around them each month when a Friendship Bridge Facilitator shares useful information with them. Using stories, drawings and role-playing, the ladies learn about setting goals, self-esteem and women’s rights. They also learn about hygiene, health and the use of medicinal plants. The women gain valuable business tools as they gain information about budgeting, accounting, pricing, marketing and customer service. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus”.

Thank you, Kiva investors, for providing the seed money for these loans!

loans.use: to purchase a variety of animals like chickens, pigs and sheep as well as their feed.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of farmers. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is married and has three children. 

She is busy with agriculture. She keeps, feeds and sells livestock at the animal market in the area where she lives. She has many years experience in this field and well knows her activity. Recently, she bought three livestock and she takes care of them for further trading. 

Her house is in a bad condition. Saodat appealed to IMON to request a loan to renovate her house. It is necessary to repair her house, because it is very old. She hopes to have a better standard of living and conditions to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her house, because it is very old and in a bad condition

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es: Emelina es una empleada de una empresa privada y emprendedora de la ganadería junto a sus padres. Es madre soltera y tiene una hija. Solicita $2,100 para la compra de materiales con el fin de hacer arreglos en su vivienda: mejora del baño, ventanas, cambio de dos puertas de acceso a la vivienda. Con esto espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hija.
texts.en:
Emelina is an employee at a private and enterprising livestock company along with her parents. She is a single mother and has a daughter. 

She is asking for $2100 in order to buy materials with the aim of making repairs in her home, including improving the bathroom, and changing the two access doors to the house. With this she hopes to improve the quality of life for her and her daughter.

loans.use: buy materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dishes as well as benches and a table to aid her in serving her delicious menu each afternoon in the local market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and inputs to seed two hectares of corn.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice used her previous loan to buy food to sell in her hotel. She is a 42-year-old married woman and mother of 4 children residing in Kasese, Uganda. She was also able to pay the school fees for her children using the proceeds. 

The challenges she faces are price fluctuations, inflation, and customers not paying on time. 

Joice's greatest desire is educating her children and building a permanent house for her family.   

Her business goals are to diversify the business and have other income generating activities like a piggery. 

Joice intends to use the loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her children

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Virginia is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married and has three children

She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as milk, water, noodles, etc and clothes.She opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $500.00.  

She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy milk, water, noodles, clothes and more items for her store

loans.name: Chigwirizano Group

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old, married, and has six children who all go to school. Mary is a tailor and she has been running her business for two years now. She sells the clothes she makes to people in her community.

She will use her loan to buy another sewing machine as she wants to employ someone to help her in running the business. She will also use the loan to pay school fees for her children. Her main intention is to educate her children and build a better house. 

The profits she made from the previous loans have helped her to provide her children with food and shelter.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a final-year student at the University of Education Winneba. The loan is to help pay for her tuition fees.She sees herself as a lecturer in the next five to ten years, giving back to the society skills learnt at school. Without this education, her dreams cannot be realized, and the help she would love to render to her community and family would not materialize.

Doreen's husband and her guardian inspire her towards her goals because they want to see her become a better person to the family and the nation as a whole. She loves children and has the desire to impart the skills acquired to help them become responsible adults in the future. But for this loan, she has no other alternative than to defer her course, an opportunity she cannot afford to miss.

Doreen would like to say a big thank you to investors and donors for such laudable program to help needy students realize their dreams.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Don Felipe tiene 7 años de criar cabras, producir leche caprina y yogurt. Con el préstamo de $2,100 que está solicitando comprará 4 cabras, un cabro semental y 3 rollos de malla ganadera. De esta manera facilitará la reproducción de sus cabras, incrementará la producción de leche y tendrá más ingresos.
texts.en: Don Felipe has been raising goats for seven years. He produces goat milk and yogurt. With the loan of $2100 that he is requesting, he will buy four female goats and one male breeder as well as three rolls of fencing. This will improve the reproduction of his goats; he will increase production of milk and have higher earnings.

loans.use: to buy goats and fencing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of ducks, chickens, turkeys and guinea pigs amongst other animals to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and shutters

loans.name: Sunavar

texts.en:
Sunavar is a kind woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1961. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has one child. 

She has years of experience doing business in the domestic market. She buys and sells kid’s clothing, tablecloths, and different clothes. She started selling socks and scarves. Her son helps her to do business. She has a good business location with easy access to customers. She buys goods from a wholesale market and sells them at retail in her place of trading. 

In the upcoming season, rubber shoes are an important item.  She wants to buy rubber shoes in order to sell them and increase her income. Unfortunately she has no money to buy rubber shoes. She asked for a loan from KIVA lenders to buy goods for the season. She hopes for your support in order to buy shoes to attract more customers to her business.

loans.use: to buy rubber shoes

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
A $800 is offered to Ernestina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy items every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, water, sugar, salt, milk and coffee.She has been involved in these business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Ernestina independent, because she can be responsible for herself and also be helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, water, sugar, salt, milk and coffee for her small store

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a 42-year-old widow and a mother of five children, three of which are school-going. She is currently residing in Mpererwe. She is a third-time borrower hoping to secure a loan of UGX 3,000,000. She intends to use this loan to add stock of cosmetics and hair gels to her retail business.

Madina operates a retail shop, and she has also started a cosmetics shop for her daughter who dropped out of school due to lack of funds for school fees. Her future plan is to expand these two businesses such that they are in position to pay school fees for her three school-going children. She greatly appreciates the efforts of the funders, especially for supporting single mothers working hard to better the futures of their families

loans.use: To buy hair gel and other beauty products to sell

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1958. She is living in a town with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a welder. She has 19 year experience of doing business. 

She runs a stall at the domestic market, where she sells greens, vegetables and tasty salads. She has regular clients every day and she is well known among sellers. She also conserves vegetables and salads. She asks for a loan to buy vegetables and ingredients for her salads. 

She hopes to sell more and gain an income to live better.

loans.use: to buy different vegetables and the ingredients to make tasty salads at her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beer, clothing, rice, and soft drinks to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1980. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has four children. Her husband works in Russia to earn money to feed his family. 

Dilorom helps her husband with keeping the family until he left for Russia. She has 20 years experience of buying and selling kid’s clothing. Eight time a month she goes to buy a collection of clothing to sell. She is polite and communicable and attracts permanent and satisfied clients. 

Recently, she wanted to buy an additional collection of clothing, but unfortunately had no money for this. She appealed to IMON and asked a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a collection of kid’s clothing for the coming season. 

She wishes to have permanent clients and earn money to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy a collection of kid’s clothing for the  coming summer season

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
A senhora Alice de 43 anos de idade,casada, trabalhadora, mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 são maiores de idade já independentes  e 1 frequenta o ensino secundário, vive em casa própria.

Pretende com o valor do empréstimo comprar: arames, janelas, chapas de zinco, pregos, para concluir a sua casa.

O cliente tem como sonho, concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família e abrir um negocio para aumentar a renda familiar, tem como principais desafios financeiros, tem recorrido ao empréstimo para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Alice is 43 years old and married. She works and has four children, two of whom are adults and one of whom is in high school. She lives in her own home.
She will use this loan to buy wire, windows, sheet metal, and nails to finish building her home.
Her dream is to finish her house to offer her family a better place to live and to expand her business and increase her family's income. Her main challenges are financial in nature. She will use this loan to overcome her difficulties and achieve her objectives.

loans.use: to buy wire, windows, sheet metal, and nails to finish building her home.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Don Gerardo es un indígena Ngobe que tiene cinco años de vender productos secos y  víveres en su almacén .  Está solicitando un crédito por $2.100 , dinero con el cual incrementará su inventario para la venta minorista, mejorarando así sus ingresos y por ende la calidad de vida de su esposa e hijo.
texts.en: Don Gerardo is a member of the Ngobe indigenous community who has been selling general merchandise, fruits and vegetables in his store for five years. He is asking for a loan of $2100. With this money he will increase his inventory for retail sale, improving his income and consequently the quality of life of his wife and son.

loans.use: buy general merchandise, fruits and vegetables to supply his retail business.

loans.name: Compressor Group

texts.en:
Irene who is in her late 40s is married with one child, who is still at school.  She has been running two businesses, a genge (grocery store) and mixes pillage (rye) flour, for fifteen years now.  She works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be Irene's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase on the genge and started making and selling mixed pillage flour and has managed to pay back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to  increase supplies for the genge and to buy baking flour, wheat flour,maize grain and soya to make mixed pillage flour.  She dreams of extending her business.

Irene will share this loan with her loan group Compressor, which consists of six members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. (There is a baby siting in front with her mother 1st left).

loans.use: to increase on the supplies for her genge (grocery store) and to buy baking flour, wheat flour,maize grain and soya to make mixed  pillage (rye) flour.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old and he supports six family members. He operates a cobbler business, which he has been doing for eight years. The business generates a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

John requested his first loan from VisionFund Kenya for 25,000 KES, which he will use to buy more repair materials to meet his customers' demands. He plans to use his profit to repay the loan and open a retail shop. He hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more repair materials

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is taking a loan of $1,500.00 USD to improve her business. She is married and has one child.  

She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy inventory for her store such as body lotion, water, slippers, beer, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, biscuits, and cigarettes. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $150.00.  Fatima is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, water, slippers, beer, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, biscuits, and cigarettes

loans.name: José Alcides

texts.es:
José tiene 51 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado de estudio académico, está casado y su esposa se dedica a las tareas del hogar, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo la menor se encuentra estudiando en la escuela, los demás son mayores y se dedican  los trabajos agrícolas.


A pesar de que las posibilidades de estudio para José fueron nulas, no le impidió ser alguien entusiasta para los trabajos que realiza, él se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva granos básicos para consumo familiar, además en ocasiones realiza trabajos de albañilería.

José solicita este crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes y venenos para controlar plagas en sus cultivos.

Él sueña con que su hija menor se supere y continúe estudiando, que sus demás hijos sientan interés por comenzar una carrera pues él está dispuesto a trabajar duro para poyarlos.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old, does not have any academic education and is married. His wife takes care of the household chores, they have 5 children, of which only the younger one attends school, the rest are adults and work in agriculture. Even though the possibility of attending school was non-existent for José, it did not prevent him from being someone who is very enthusiastic about the work he does. He works in agriculture, growing basic grains for family consumption. In addition, he sometimes does construction work.

José request this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pest control products for his crops. He dreams of his younger daughter getting ahead, to continue with her education and for the rest of his children to become interested in starting a career.  He is willing to work hard to support them.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pest control products for his crops.

loans.name: Baiao

texts.pt:
O senhor Baião de 51 anos de idade, solteiro, trabalhador  pai de 5 filhos dos quais 2 já  são independentes, 2 frequentam o ensino secundário, e 1 o ensino primário vive em casa própria.

Pretende com o valor do empréstimo comprar: areia, chapas de zinco, pedra, cimento, para dar continuidade da sua obra levantando mais um quarto
.
O cliente tem como sonho, concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família, construir aviários em sua casa para criar e vender frangos para garantir uma vida sustentável a sua família, tem como principais desafios financeiros, tem recorrido ao empréstimo para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Baião is 51 years of age and unmarried. He is a laborer and the father of five children, two of whom are living on their own, two of whom attend secondary school, and one of whom is in primary school. He owns his own home.
He plans to use this loan to buy sand, sheet metal, stone, and cement to continue the construction work building another room on his house.
His dream is to finish his home to offer his family a better place to live and build chicken coops so he can raise and sell chickens and ensure his family's livelihood. His main challenges are financial in nature. He needs this loan to overcome his difficulties and achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy sand, sheet metal, stone, and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and sand to complete his residence

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
A senhora Elisa de 38 anos de idade, casada, comerciante, mãe de 3 filhos que  frequentam o ensino secundário, vive em casa própria.

Pretende com o valor do empréstimo comprar: peixe, batata, arroz, açúcar, farinha de milho, sardinha, feijão, amendoim, bolachas, trigo, vinagre, omo, caldo, sabonete, óleo, cremora, trigo. Maionese, agua mineral, mayo, massa esparguete, cebola para ampliar o seu negocio.

O cliente tem como sonho ,ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, comprar um tractor para fazer trabalhos nas machambas de forma a aumentar a renda familiar.

O seu principal desafio é  financeiro, tem recorrido ao xitique e ao empréstimo para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Alcinda is 38 years old and the single mother of three children who are in secondary school. She lives in her own home.
She plans to use this loan to buy fish, potatoes, rice, sugar, corn flour, sardines, beans, peanuts, crackers, wheat, vinegar, soap, oil, mayonnaise, mineral water, pasta, and other products to expand her business.
Her dream is to expand her business to meet her customers' needs and buy a tractor to work on local farms so she can increase her family's income.
Her main challenge is financial in nature. She has come to the village bank for a loan to help her address her difficulties and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy fish, potatoes, rice, sugar, corn flour, sardines, beans, peanuts, crackers, wheat, vinegar, soap, oil, mayonnaise, mineral water, pasta, and other products.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 52 years old and supports a family of four members. She has been operating a food stall business for the last four years earning a monthly income of 5,500 KES. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to use to increase her inventory in order to increase sales and her income. 

She plans to use gained profits to repay the loan, as well as to educate her children. 

Her hope is to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: to increase her inventory to improve her profits

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in masks and carvings. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, aluminum sheets, and stain.

Emmanuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"After completing a course in auto mechanics, getting a job was difficult and neither my parents nor I could afford the high cost of the machinery I would need to set up on my own. I struggled by doing menial jobs, but I managed to save what I could until I had enough money to buy a small piece of land and raise a wooden store. I started buying finished carvings, and in the evenings I learned to carve these beautiful items. My inspiration comes through dreams, so when I wake up I immediately put the design on paper in order not to lose the idea."

"I really could not do without this microcredit. I am so thankful to you all."

Use the link below to view Emmanuel's masks and carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1536

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, aluminum sheets, and stain

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is an old client of the institution.  He is married, with eight children of whom, seven attend school.  He is an agriculturalist who rears cattle and does small scale farming, though his main business is as a butcher, where he slaughters pigs and sells pork in the village trading centre. This is his major source of income, which he has done for over 15 years. 

He also does cattle fattening and trades in drinks (beers, sodas & bottled water) alongside his pork selling business. His major challenge was limited capital to stock pigs to meet his increasing customers. This has greatly affected his operations. 

To overcome this challenge, he joined Ugafode for financial assistance to boost his businesses. Using the loans from UGAFODE, Milton has been able to expand his business whereby he opened up two more pork outlets. He also makes deliveries to different areas her serves.  His customers live within Buyanja and Rukungiri Districts. 

It is from his businesses that Milton has been able to pay school fees for his children, built a nice looking residential house and other personal developments. He applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to buy more pigs, so as to increase his profitability. 

Milton thanks Ugafode for the financial empowerment that has made him a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy pigs and other animals to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda is taking a loan of $1,500.00 USD to improve her business. She is married, has six children, and is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy inventory to for her store such as fish, milk, rice, beer, cigarettes, oils, slippers, noodles, sugar, salt, and biscuits.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $400.00.  

She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: to buy fish, milk, rice, beer, cigarettes, oils, slippers, noodles, sugar, salt, and biscuits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar-powered system for heating water in the family house

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred  raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She is a 36-year-old  married woman, with five  children residing in Talibon, Bohol.  To augment her income, she also engages in a food vending business. She sells snack food like banana cue( deep fried banana w/ caramelized sugar). She has been engaged in that kind of business for 4 years now. He husband works as a laborer. She is facing financial problems that could prevent her existing livelihood to continue to operate. 

She  is asking for a loan to purchase more supplies like bananas, cooking oil and pig feed. These ingredients will be used in preparing more snack foods to sell. She also continue raises and sells quality hogs. Thus, this will cause to improve her daily income. With these she could now afford delicious meals for the whole family.

She dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable for the improvement of the family's living condition.

loans.use: to  purchase more pig feed and supplies like bananas, cooking oil

loans.name: Embassy Group

texts.en:
Kibwana, who is in his mid 50s is married with seven children, three of them are at school and four are grown-up.  He has been running a retail business since 1995.  He works from 06am to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kibwana's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to keep increasing the shop investment and has successfully paid back all his loans.  He is really doing great and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group whose members are now able to support their families and to take their kids to good schools and other kids are in colleges now.  He used his profit to pay school fees, bought a shamba,(coffee farm), loan repayment and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase the shop inventory and meet his customers' demand. He dreams developing his shamba (coffee farm)

Kibwana will share this loan with his loan group Embassy which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable on paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory to meet his customers' demand. And develop his shamba (coffee farm)

loans.name: Sukriye

texts.en:
Şükriye is a married mother of two, one of whom has health problems.  She began working by making and selling handicrafts. Later she started to buy and sell ready made muslin bedclothes.  

She now buys and sells various products like duvet covers, polar blankets, and muslin fabric.  She sells to certain customers, including employees and families of patients at the two rehabilitation centers, where she takes her child.  

With the loan she will buy bedclothes, polar blankets and muslin fabric.  She wants to buy a house and for her son to get better.

loans.use: to buy bedclothes, polar blankets and muslin fabric, to help her child who has health problems

loans.name: Stevin

texts.en: Stevin is 43 years old, married with four children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Stevin sells cosmetics at retail prices and has been in that business for four years. To supplement his income, he also grows vanilla beans. Due to limited capital, Stevin has decided to get a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and bricks to construct his residential house. That would fulfill his family's dream of living in a well-furnished house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such cement, sand and bricks.

loans.name: Cesia Lili

texts.es:
Cesia, de 24 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja es fotógrafo, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad.

Cesia, es empleada en un comedor desde hace 2 años, también se dedica al cultivo de plantas frutales y ornamentales, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo viaja en bus urbano y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar semillas, bolsas para el cultivo y también en gastos médicos. 

Ella sueña que su cultivo se desarrolle en buen estado y que su hijo tenga un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Cesia is 24 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and her husband is a photographer. She has a three year-old child. Cesia has been an employee of a small restaurant for two years. She also grows fruit and ornamental plants. To arrive at her workplace, she travels by city bus and her work hours are from 7 am to 3 pm. 

She needs the loan to buy seeds, potting bags (seen in the photo) and also for medical expenses. She dreams that her plants develop in good shape and that her little boy has a good future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, and potting bags and to pay medical expenses.

loans.name: Melvin Antonio

texts.es:
Melvin, de 25 años de edad, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, en su casa vive su mamá.

Melvin, se dedica a trabajar en una distribuidora de gas desde hace 2 años, pero también se dedica a la agricultura.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de café y para comprar una motocicleta.

Él sueño de Melvin, es comprar un vehículo y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Melvin is 25 years old and has a partner who works buying and selling fruits and vegetables. He has a 3 year old daughter and his mother lives with him. Melvin has worked for a company that distributes gas for 2 years but he also works in agriculture.

He needs the loan to buy farm supplies to grow coffee and to buy a motorcycle.

Melvin’s dream is to purchase a vehicle and to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies to grow coffee and to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Suhad

texts.en:
Suhad is a 30-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband in a small house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector  where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Suhad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help her to provide hot water without using electricity. 

Suhad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Thavy is a 24-year-old single freshman, and he is from the Tbong Khmum Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in management in a university in the province. 

Thavy's father is a carpenter, and his mother is a homemaker. Because he is short of finances to cover the tuition fees for his first through to fourth years, he would like to request a loan. 

With this loan, Thavy will be able to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. His dream is to have a proper job with a decent salary, so that he will be able to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to cover the tuition fees for his first through to fourth years of university.

loans.name: Malu Sandy

texts.es: Malú de 22 años de edad,  soltera y sin hijos,estudiante de química en la universidad,estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Con la ayuda de sus padres, Malú con mucha dedicación a sus  estudios está logrando un buen record de notas y así poder ser una buen profesional.Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones y  realizar la compra  de materiales de estudio que necesita. Malú  se encuentra muy agradecida  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a Kiva y Edaprospo.
texts.en:
Malu is 22 years old, is single without children, and studies chemistry at university. She works a lot in order to reach her goals in life. With the help of her parents, Malu is achieving good grades due to her hard work, and therefore will be able to become a strong professional.

With the loan, she will invest in to pay for her housing and to buy the materials she needs to study. Malu is very happy for the help given and has many wishes to fulfil her goals with the help of Kiva and Edaprospo.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to study

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 20-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband in a small house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector  where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Maryam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help her to provide hot water without using electricity. 

Maryam appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the stock of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mayra Graciela

texts.es: Mayra tiene 32 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo de 8 años vive con sus padres en Guranda parroquia Salinas provincia de Bolivar, tiene un restaurant el cual se encuentra un poco en mal estado por lo que se solicita el crédito para arreglar el mismo para pintar, poner ceramica en la cocina y hacer un pequeño baño para dar una mejor antención a sus clientes, su sueño es tener un restaurante mas grande tipo bufet, realiza las compras en Guaranda cada 8 días, en su tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en: Mayra is 32-years old.  She is single and has an 8-year old son.  She lives with her parents in Guranda, Salinas Parrish, Bolivar Province.  Mayra has a restaurant that's in a bit of disrepair.  She is requesting the loan to fix it up.  She wants to paint, put down tile in the kitchen and put in a small bathroom to better serve her customers.  Mayra's dream is to have a bigger, buffet-style restaurant.  She purchases her supplies in Guaranda every week, and in her free time, she likes to watch television.

loans.use: to fix up her restaurant.

loans.name: Evarline

texts.en:
Evarline is 32 years old and supports five family members. She has been a farmer for the last nine years and earns a monthly income of 11,000 KES. 

Evarline requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya for 25,000 KES, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and inputs for a better produce when harvest comes to meet the demands of her clients. She plans to use the profit to repay the loan and expand her agricultural sector. She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and inputs

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta operates a tricycle (motorcycle with side car) transportation service. She has run this business for more than 10 years now. She is a 34-year-old married mother of three children and resides in Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 15 and the youngest is 7. 

Marieta has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fuel and tires and pay for maintenance like changing oil. This would definitely improve the services she offers and would prevent delays when transporting passengers to remote areas.

With the resources available, she would like to expand her business and earn enough to support the education of her children for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy fuel and tires and pay for maintenance like changing oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her farming and increase her income to improve her family's living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and farm tools for improving her agricultural produce and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Félix Gabriel

texts.es:
Félix, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está soltero y vive en casa de sus padres y lo que gana en el trabajo lo aporta para los gastos del hogar. 

Félix, trabaja en la agricultura desde temprana edad, lo aprendió de su padre y también trabaja como albañil.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono y pesticidas para sembrar camote, yuca, maíz y para comprar ganado. 

Él sueña con hacer más grande su casa y de ladrillo, porque actualmente es de lámina y bahareque.
texts.en:
Felix is 25 years old and studied until 5th grade. He is single and lives in his parents house, what he earns from working he uses to contribute to the household expenses. 

Felix has worked in agriculture from a young age, he learnt from his father and also works in construction

He needs the loan to purchase fertiliser and pesticides to plant sweet potatoes, yucca, corn and to purchase cattle.

His dream is to make his house bigger and construct it with bricks, because at the moment it is made of metal sheets and mud walls.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and pesticides to plant sweet potatoes, yucca, corn and to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his tea plantation.

loans.name: Angola Group

texts.en:
Stella is 34 years old, married with four children and only two go to school. She sustains her family by running a tea room, were she sells tea and doughnuts. She uses the profits obtained from her business to pay school fees to her children and to provide them with their needed resources.  

She wants to get a loan in order to construct a better house and send her children to better schools. She has experienced a positive change since she started getting the loans, as she is now able to provide basic needs to her children.

loans.use: to construct a better house and send her children to better schools

loans.name: Gloria Yeannette

texts.es:
Gloria, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos estudian.

Gloria, tiene un puesto de frutas y verduras en el mercado de la ciudad desde hace más de 10 años. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más frutas y verduras y fortalecer más su negocio.

Ella sueña con ampliar más grande su negocio de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Gloria is 39 years old and went to school up to the second grade. She has a partner who is a farmer, and she has 3 children, two of which go to school. Gloria has had a fruit and vegetable stand in the city market for over 10 years.

She needs the loan to buy more fruit and vegetables to strengthen her business. She dreams of expanding her fruit and vegetable business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and vegetables to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena lives in the remote mountain region of Svaneti with her family. She has five children and seven grandchildren. She has a small farm with cows, a field, and a vegetable garden. 

Lena also grows herbs such as parsley, dill, coriander, garlic, and laserwort in her garden. They are dried and crushed in a mortar. The right mix, together with salt, makes the delicious traditional spice blend Svaneti salt. The production is partly for the family's own use and partly for sale. 

This loan helps Lena to grow more vegetables and herbs as well as to buy salt and some herbs she does not cultivate herself. With a larger production and sales volume, she will increase the family's income.

loans.use: to grow more vegetables and herbs and to buy other ingredients for producing a traditional spice blend.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is single, but she has a son. She is 28 years old and still lives in El Alto in her own house. 

Juana is an experienced seamstress. She learned about this business when she was a child. Juana is still making Andean skirts, and now she is making vicuña blankets as well. 

Juana works hard. She has pain in her back, and her sight is also at risk. Nevertheless, Juana is asking for a loan to buy wool and fabrics for her business. She would like to have a bigger workshop and to hire an assistant. She hopes you can help her again.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making skirts and shawls.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina earns a living through fishing. She sells fish at the local market in her community. She is a 57-year-old married mother of 5 grown dependents.  She has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years now, and she needs capital to finance her fishing business.

Josefina is requesting a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets. These will help improve her catch and increase her earnings. With the additional profit, she will be able to set aside some savings for emergency use. She could also expand her business.

Josefina hopes that, one day, she will be successful in managing her business and can enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets.

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is 27 years old, and she is married with one child.

Remelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional inventory of groceries to sell.

Remelyn has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 2 years, though she also earns income from fattening pigs.

Remelyn aspires to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado en la escuela de la comunidad, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al trabajo doméstico, tiene solo un hijo, que aún no asiste a la escuela, porque está muy pequeño.

Carlos, trabaja en la agricultura desde muy temprana edad, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres y actualmente trabaja de motorista en una empresa constructora. 

Carlos, necesita el dinero para comprar una motocicleta, la adquisición de este medio de transporte le permitirá llegar más rápido hasta su trabajo. 

El sueña con hacer su casa de bloque, porque actualmente está construida con bahareque.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25-years old.  He attended his local school until 6th grade.  He is married, and his wife his a homemaker.  Carlos has one son who doesn't go to school because he is very young. 

Carlos has worked in agriculture since a very young age.  He learned the work from his parents.  Carlos currently works as a driver for a construction company.  

Carlos needs the money to purchase a motorcycle.  Acquiring this mode of transportation will allow him to get to work more quickly. 

Carlos's dream is to build a brick house, as his current home is waddle and daub (woven together stalks filled in with straw and mud).

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a new client at UGAFODE Microfinance with a loan of 2,000,000 UGX.  

His major source of income is a piggery. He also at times does transport using a taxi to ferry people to different destinations. He has operated the piggery for 8 years. 

Andrew joined Ugafode to access financial support and expand his business of a piggery and also to repair his vehicle. Andrew’s dream is to expand his piggery business and become the main supplier of pigs to both farmers and pig owners within and around Rukungiri district.

Andrew hopes to achieve this dream with Ugafode’s financial support.    He appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for the tremendous work of alleviating poverty among the rural communities.

loans.use: To buy pigs for sale and also to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Valle Triunfo Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 7 personas   emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal “EMPRENDEDORAS DEL VALLE TRIUNFO”.  La Sra. Gladys de 30 años de edad y con 2 hijos, tiene un pequeño negocio de confección de polos y venta de bisutería. La Sra. Gladys ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar. En el futuro le gustaría ampliar  su negocio(CONFECCIONES) y poder vender sus productos confeccionados que le generaran más ingresos y a su vez a promover oportunidades de trabajo, y así  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más material de confección y así  seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes  y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Gladys y todos los integrantes del grupo se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se les ha brindado. La Sra. Gladys es la primera del lado derecho la de los lentes, la que viste con un polo de color blanco y celeste y su cartera, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of seven enterprising people who are very creative in their businesses. This is the “Emprendedoras Del Valle Triunfo” (Valle Triunfo Entrepreneurs) communal bank.

Sra. Gladys is 30-years old and has two children. She has a small business making t-shirts and selling costume jewelry. Sra. Gladys has earned her customers' loyalty, which has generated the earnings she needs to meet her household expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business (making clothing) and be able to sell the products she makes to generate more income. She would also like to foster some employment opportunities, which will earn her even more money. With the loan she has been granted, Sra. Gladys will invest in the purchase of materials for making clothing. This will allow her to continue meeting her customer's needs and be able to get ahead.

Sra. Gladys and all the communal bank members are very grateful for Kiva and the loan hey have been granted. They are also grateful for the confidence placed in them.

In the above photo, Sra. Gladys is first from the right. She is wearing glasses and a white and blue t-shirt and carrying a purse. Sra. Gladys leaves you with the promise that she will meet all the goals she has set for herself.

loans.use: to expand her business and purchase textiles.

loans.name: Saboat

texts.en:
Saboat is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers. She is living in small town with her family. She is married and has three children. She is capable, honest, responsible and kind person. 

She is busy with buying and selling women shoes. She well knows how to communicate with customer and likes her activity. She has regular clients every day. The money that she earns is spent for family needs. 

She need to renovate her house and asks a loan from KIVA lenders. After renovation she will have a better condition to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her house, for the improvement of her family lives

loans.name: Geramie

texts.en:
Geramie is 25 years old, is a married woman with one kid in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Geramie has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Geramie requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

Geramie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Geramie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mixed merchandise in bulk, such as clothing, footwear and female accessories etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan tiene 34 años de edad es soltero vive con sus padres en la parroquia Salinas provincia de Bolivar el se dedica a la cria de animales como cerdos y pollos, solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceado para sus animales asi poder aumentar el capital de trabajo y poder mejorar su economia, las compras realiza en Guaranda cada mes, su sueño es agrandar su negocio, los desafios a los que se enfrenta es la falta de oportunidades, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Juan is 34 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the parish of Salinas in the Bolivar province. He raises animals such as pigs and chickens. Juan is requesting this loan to buy balanced feed for his animals and thus be able to increase his working capital and improve his finances. He makes his purchases in Guaranda every month. Juan's dream is to make his business bigger. The challenge he faces is the lack of opportunities. In his free time, Juan likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 46 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Angelita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Angelita has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a fifty-year-old man living in Masindi Uganda. He is married with seven children and operates a retail shop. To supplement on the income he built rentals and has a school which he owns. 

He is a very hard working man who used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. His businesses are challenged by high inflation rate, yet he has a business dream of trading in wholesale.

Patrick has requested a loan to buy items like salt,soap,cooking oil and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy items like salt,soap,cooking oil and others to sell.

loans.name: Sibel

texts.en:
Sibel is a married mother of two.  She owns her own tailoring shop.  

When she received her first micro-loan, Sibel was sewing at home for outside buyers. Increasing her income with the help of the micro-loan, she bought another sewing machine and opened a store.  She has carried out her business for one year.  

With the third loan she will buy an overlock sewing machine.  She wants to grow her business by creating a brand and sewing custom designed outfits for customers.  Her dream is to provide for a good future for her children.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, to help grow her business

loans.name: Upile Group

texts.en:
Eliza thanks Kiva for the previous loan that was granted her. She used the loan to expand her business, and she used the profits she earned to pay her children's school fees. She also used her profits to provide her children with food and good shelter.

Eliza is requesting another loan as she wants to diversify her business. She wants to open a grocery store. She believes this business will greatly help her improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers and also firewood for her brick making business

loans.name: Niyamaddin

texts.en:
Niyamaddin is 34 years old. He has been married over six years and has two children. They are living in the Baku region, but they are IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli City. 

A while ago, Niyamaddin started a clothing sales business. Today, Niyammadin wants to support his business, and for that he needs a loan in the amount of 1,100 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this amount, Niyamaddin plans to buy more clothes for selling, develop his business and increase his monthly income. 

Niyamaddin wishes the best for his children, and he works hard. He says a great thanks to the Kiva organization for support.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell, increasing his monthly income and helping his children to get an education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow inorder to start a business of supplying milk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school. She has no additional family member. 

Aisha operates a beauty salon at the market. She has been in this business for the last seven years. 

Aisha works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a hand dryer, relaxers, treatments, oils, and shampoo. Her major business challenge includes power shortages. Her goal and aspiration is to improve the image of her salon so as to attract more customers. 

Aisha lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a hand dryer, relaxers, treatments, oils, and shampoo

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 31 years old and married with four children. All of them are attend school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Irene runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Irene has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Irene would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Fuentes De Vida Group

texts.es: Doña María Isabel es la presidenta del Banco Mujer Fuentes de Vida. Casada, con 54 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos. Todos mayores de edad. Actualmente viven con ella junto con sus nietos. Es una señora que se ha dedicado siempre a la actividad pecuaria como lo es la ganadería. Ella junto con su esposo tienen ganado, algunas vacas son lecheras, y de éstas hacen queso para vender en su comundiad. Su esposo tiene una edad que le es difícil conseguir trabajo y por eso tiene ésta actividad productiva la cual es la principal fuente de ingreso en su hogar. Ellos hacen todo el proceso para obtener el queso. También venden natilla y cuajadas producto de la leche que les da dos vacas. Ella quiere financiamiento para comprar otra vaca lechera. Éste grupo tiene trayectoria en la Fundación y siempre han mostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad. Son muy trabajadoras y todas buscan un mismo propósito, superarse y crecer en las actividades con la finalidad de generar ingresos y ayudar en sus hogares, asi mejorar las condiciones de vida. Junto con María trabajan 3 socias más, las cuales van a invertir en actividades como comercio y pecuarias.
texts.en:
María Isabel is the president this communal bank, Banco Mujer Fuentes de Vida. She is 54 years old, married, and has three children. All of them are now adults but they are currently living with her, as well as her grandchildren. She has always worked with livestock. She and her husband own cattle. Some of the cows are dairy cows, and they use their milk to make cheese, which they sell throughout their community. Her husband is at an age where it is hard for him to find work, which is why they run this business. It is their household's main source of income. They carry out the whole cheese-making process. They also sell other dairy products, like sour cream and cottage cheese, from the milk of two of their cows. María Isabel wants financing in order to buy another dairy cow.

Throughout its history with Fundación Mujer, this group has always been responsible and timely. Its members are very hard workers and they all share the same goal: to grow and improve themselves and their businesses in order to generate income and contribute to their households so that their living conditions improve. Besides María, the group comprises three other members who will invest in their retail and livestock businesses, respectively.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 57 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, noodles and other personal products. 

In the future Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Şerife

texts.en:
