Şerife is an educator and for 12 years she has managed the daycare center she founded.  She opened her first daycare center in a small apartment and grew her business by working day and night.  

Six months ago she moved the daycare center into a bigger, two-bedroom building.  She also does management and education relating to Amway products.  With her third loan she wants to buy needed supplies for the daycare center.  

She would like to grow her business by opening different branches.

loans.use: to buy needed supplies for her expanding child daycare center

loans.name: Molice

texts.en:
Molice is a 39-year-old client who is widowed and has 4 children of who all attend school. 

He has operated a retail shop and bar for over 20 years. Molice found it hard to meet all his financial needs with his business alone and decided to join UGAFODE for financial support to supplement his business income. He has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX to increase his working business capital since he reduced business capital by paying school fees. 

Molice praises UGAFODE for its financial support which has enabled him to take his children to good schools and also sustain his business.

loans.use: to purchase salt, sugar, soap, and boxes of matches to sell.

loans.name: Avisai Antonio

texts.es:
Avisai tiene 27 años de edad, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia en la escuela, el otro no porque está muy pequeño y son los únicos que dependen de él.


Avisai se dedica a la agricultura, esto lo hace para asegurar la alimentación de su familia, además a él le fascina la música, es por ello que se involucra en el grupo musical de la iglesia donde él asiste.

Él está solicitando este crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, venenos, etc. Y pagar mano de obra para los cultivos de maíz y frijol.

Uno de sus sueños más grandes es tener una mejor vivienda pues actualmente su casa es de bahareque, además espera que sus hijos sean personas educadas y preparadas académicamente, es por ello que está dispuesto a trabajar fuerte para poder lograr todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Avisai is 27 years old, in a relationship and his partner takes care of the household. He has two children, only one of which is going to school, the other one does not, because it is too young. They are the only ones that depend on him.

Avisai makes a living in agriculture to provide for his family. He also loves music, which is why he is involved in a music group of the church he attends.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, manure, poison, et cetera, and to pay for the labor of growing corn and beans.

One of his biggest dreams is to have a better living situation because at the moment his house is made of waddle and daub. He is also hoping that his children will be educated people and academically prepared. They are the reason, he is willing to work hard for, so they will be able to achieve all their goals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, manure, poison, et cetera, and to pay for the labor of growing corn and beans.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Félix de 59 años de edad, es una persona luchadora que a pesar de sus dificultades físicas ha trabajado como agricultor, él mantiene a su esposa y a sus 3 hijos.

Félix tiene una larga trayectoria en la actividad agrícola, ya que siempre siembra sus milpas con el objetivo de comercializar granos básicos y también para dar alimentación a su familia.

Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando a Félix a comprar productos para preparar las tierras y obtener una cosecha exitosa y buscara apoyo en la contratación de jornaleros para incrementar la producción de granos básicos

Él planea  realizar un invernadero en el futuro con las ganancias obtenidas por medio de la comercialización  de los granos básicos aprovechando que sus tierras son muy productivas.
texts.en:
Félix is 59-years old.  He is a determined person.  In spite of his physical difficulties, he has worked as a farmer and supported his wife and three children.  

Félix has been in agriculture for a long time.  He always plants his fields with the goal of selling staple grains and also feeding his family. 

The loan will help Félix to purchase the products he needs to prepare his lands and have a successful harvest.  He will also look for some day labor to increase his staple grain production. 

In the future, Félix plans to use is earnings from selling his staple grains to build a green house.  He wants to make good use of his very productive land.

loans.use: to purchase products for preparing his land and having a successful harvest.

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.en:
Bunafsha is an active woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has three children.

She is trading in the domestic market, buying and selling women’s and men’s clothing. She has 20 years of experience as a seller. Her husband helps and supports her in her business.

She requests a loan for the first time from IMON and Kiva lenders for her business. She wants to buy a new collection of clothes. She hopes to be supported and wishes to have more customers.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 42 years old and married. He supports a family of nine members. He has been operating as a small-scale farmer for the last six years and earns KES 23,000 per month.

Evans has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified seed for high production.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay the loan and educate his children.

He hopes is to be financially stable and be the leading in selling.

loans.use: To buy certified seed for high production.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 45 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sandra operates a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 25 years. 

Sandra requested a loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 27-year-old woman who is married with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. Her major business is farming, whereby she mainly grows cereals like rice and maize, which has helped her to earn more income to support her family. She also has a retail shop selling general merchandise to supplement her income. 

Shamim is affected by seasonal factors like the prolonged dry spell and bush burning which sometimes reduces her expected income. Shamim has a family dream of educating her children from the best schools. She is requesting to hire oxen for plowing her maize garden.

loans.use: to hire oxen for plowing her maize garden.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas of Kamwenge, Uganda, used his previous loan to buy fertilizers, mulches and manure for his farm. He is a farmer, growing primarily bananas. He also has rentals and livestock. He raises cows for fattening and gets a monthly salary as other sources of income. He has been able  to educate his children and improve on his welfare. He hopes to improve his banana plantation, however his main challenges are still prolonged droughts and soil exhaustion. 

Abbas is requesting this loan to buy more manure, fertilizers and mulch for his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy more manure, fertilizers and mulch for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Colleb

texts.en:
Colleb is a 32-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He rears livestock to earn income and provide for his family. He also gets extra income from farming. His intention is to be a modern farmer, though he is limited by inadequate capital and lack of grass and water for his animals. 

Colleb is requesting a loan to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.name: Kanyongo Farmers S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The woman raising her hand in the photo is Josephine, who is forty-five years old, married, and has three children who are all attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH.EA) in 2013 to benefit from savings mobilization, enterprise development and financial management training. 

She is currently practicing horticulture and borrowing to buy fertilizers in order to increase production of her horticultural farming, and hence earn more income. This will enable her to pay her children's tuition fees.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in order to increase production of her horticultural farming hence earn more income to pay tuition fees for her children.

loans.name: Dalius

texts.en:
Dalius is a new client of the institution who is applying for a loan of UGX 1,500,000. Dalius is 25 years of age and is newly married. He hails from Kishanda, Nyakinengo, Nyakagyeme, rural Rukungiri. 

His main activity is agriculture, and he supplements his income by way of a motorcycle transport business commonly known as boda boda. His main challenge has been limited capital, and he hopes that this loan will assist him in buying another motorcycle and to improve his agriculture business. This will help him increase his income, which will enable him to sustain himself and his family. 

Dalius looks forward to buying more motorcycles, and in the future selling those motorcycles to buy a bigger motor vehicle to ease the transport problems of his area. He thanks UGAFODE for that financial support and looks forward to the same in the future.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Félix Esteban

texts.es:
Félix de 26 años de edad, está soltero y no tiene hijos, solo pudo estudiar hasta cuarto grado ya que su familia no podía apoyarlo, en casa viven su mamá, una hermana, un sobrino y su abuelo.

Desde muy pequeño Félix se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, pero hace 9 meses se presentó a una ferretería a solicitar trabajo, tuvo la suerte de ser atendido y con seguridad le dieron un puesto laboral, él se desempeña como cargador de mercadería, tarda 30 minutos para llegar al trabajo y se va en bus, trabaja de lunes a domingo de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm.
 

Este crédito lo solicita para comprar insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, venenos, etc. para aplicarlos a los cultivos. 

Félix sueña con mejorar la casa de su madre, comprar una vivienda propia y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Félix, 26, is single and doesn't have any children. He could only study until the 4th grade because his family could no longer pay for it. He lives with his mom, his sister, his nephew, and his grandma.

Since he was very young, Félix has worked in agriculture, but 9 months ago he went to a hardware store to look for work. He was fortunate to be helped and they gave him a job. He works as a merchandise loader. It takes 30 minutes to get to his job by bus and he works Monday through Sunday from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

Félix is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies such as manure, fertilizer, and pest applications for his crops. He dreams of improving his mom's house and of buying his own house and starting a family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as manure, fertilizer, and pest applications for his crops.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is an old client at the institution who is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX. She is 37 years old and happilly married to Moses. They have one child. Diana works with a Christian NGO.  

Apart from her job, she deals in the timber business in and around Rukungiri district. She says her major challenge has been limited capital, and she hopes that this loan will enable her to expand her business and generate more income to sustain herself and her family. Her future plans are to buy more land and plant more trees to meet the future demand for timber. 

Diana thanks UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for the financial support and looks forward to the same support in future.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Jose  Mari

texts.en:
Jose Mari is 35 years old and operates a habal-habal (motorcycle) transportation service. She is a mother of 2 children, aged 12 and 16 years. In addition, she is also engaged in selling barbecue. She sells pork, chicken, sausage, and hot dog barbecue to the locals in her area. She lives in Getafe, Bohol.

Jose Mari is requesting a loan to buy both tools to maintain her motorcycle and supplies to prepare food such as meat, soft drinks, and seasonings. These materials are needed to continue her transportation services and food vending businesses. Her earnings will improve, and she will be able to meet her expenses.

With the additional profit she earns, Jose Mari could expand her business and thus both improve her family's welfare and sustain a better standard of living for the years to come.

loans.use: to buy both tools to maintain her motorcycle and supplies to prepare food such as meat, soft drinks, and seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her salon.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Grace has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Grace has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is a 38-year-old married factory worker with 3 children in her care. She resides in Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia, and all 3 of her children attend school. Her husband is also 38 years old, and he earn some income from pig fattening. Together, they can earn around USD$9.50 per day. 

Now, Chanthy would like to apply for a loan to build a bathroom with a toilet. With this loan she will be able to provide her family with a bathroom, allowing them to live in hygienic conditions. 

In the future, Chanthy wants to save enough money to both build a proper house and support her children so they can finish high school.

loans.use: to build a bathroom with a toilet.

loans.name: Deivis

texts.es: Deivis de 23 años de edad, fabrica calzado para damas. El habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 meses y 15 años, al sur de la ciudad, donde se encuentra su taller. Su experiencia data de hace 3 años, cuando en el año 2012, decidió emprender su pequeño taller de calzado, siguiendo la tradición de sus padres, quienes  en su tierra natal tienen una pequeña fábrica donde Deivis aprendió todo lo que él hoy sabe y le agregó su experiencia actual. En su pequeño taller se realizan todas  las operaciones de diseño, corte y confección, vende a crédito todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde y compra de contado a mayoristas ubicados en la zona comercial del centro de la ciudad, quienes le ofrecen precios competitivos, que le permiten establecer costos ajustados a las necesidades de compra de su clientela. Su meta más adelante es abrir más nichos de mercado, pues en la actualidad produce para pequeñas chazas o puntos comerciales informales del centro de la ciudad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cuero, sintéticos, herrajes y otros accesorios importantes para aumentar su producción, que con esta inversión llegará  con novedosos diseños, de Deivis para su apreciada clientela. Con esta inversión, ampliará la gama de ofertas para sus clientes, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Deivis is 23 years old and makes women's footwear. He lives with his wife and two children aged 9 months and 15 years old in the south of the city where his workshop is. His work experience dates from 3 years ago in 2012 when he decided to open his small footwear workshop. He is following the footsteps of his parents who in their native land had a small factory where Delvis learned all he knows today in addition to his own experience.

In his small shop he does all kinds of design work, cutting and sewing. He sells on credit every day from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening. He buys from wholesalers located in the commercial area in the center of the city who offer competitive prices which allows him to establish prices adapted to the buying needs of his customers. His goal for the future is to open to more niche markets as currently he produces for small stalls and informal sales points in the center of the city.

He is currently applying for a loan from Kiva, the first loan he has had from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy leather, synthetic fabric, fittings and other accessories that are important to increase his production. With this new investment he will come up with new designs for his appreciative clientele. With the inversion he will expand the range of offerings for his clients making this Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to buy leather, synthetic fabrics, fittings and other accessories.

loans.name: Perihan

texts.en:
Perihan is married and she has two children. She operates a silver shop. She first started her career by acquiring a franchise of a pastry shop, which she  ran for 10 years with the help of her son. After her son left for his military service, she sold the franchise and did not work.  

Since Perihan does not like being out of action, she decided to purchase a silver jewelry shop, which she has been operating for a year.  She requested her second loan, which she will use to purchase some silver jewelry and some watches. Her future plans are to move ahead with her shop and support her daughter to be a lawyer. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Perihan Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Gümüşcü dükkanı işletiyor.  Perihan Hanım iş hayatına bir börekçinin bayiliğini alarak başlıyor.  Oğlu ile birlikte on yıl bu işi yapıyor.  Oğlu askere gidince tek başına zorlandığından dükkanını devretmek zorunda kalıyor.  Bir süre çalışmıyor.  Evde oturmak kendisini sıktığından tekrar bir iş yapmak istiyor.  Kuzeninin fikir vermesi  ve teşvikiyle gümüşçü dükkanını devralıyor.  Bir yıldır  bu işi yapıyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile dükkanına gümüş takılar ve saat alacak.  Gelecek de işini daha da büyütmek ve kızının avukat olmasını istiyor.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry and watches

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James of Kamwenge, Uganda is a hardworking married man. He sells produce to earn a living and pay school fees for children. He also rears livestock to earn an extra income. He hopes to expand his business to a wholesale store. He complains of price fluctuation of the agricultural produce he trades in.

He is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica, tiene 4 hijos, sus hijos mayores le ayudan a cuidar las vaquillas que tienen, ellos en la mañana estudian y por la tarde cuidan las dos vacas. 

Juan, trabaja como corralero desde hace 12 años, también en sus días libres cultiva maíz, todos los días trabaja desde las 11:00 de la mañana y el resto del día trabaja en sus propios trabajos.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar otra vaca lechera, su objetivo es dedicarse a la producción y venta de leche, para tener tiempo para construir su casa. 

Juan, sueña con terminar de construir su casa, ya que donde vive es de un primo y su familia es grande y la casa pequeña, además desea tener su propio negocio de productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Juan has a ninth-grade-level education. He is married and his wife works as a housekeeper. They have four children, and the older ones help him take care of his heifers. They go to school in the morning and in the afternoon they tend to the two cows. He has been working with cattle for twelve years. He also grows corn in his spare time. He works every day from 11:00 am, and the rest of the day he works on his own businesses.

Juan needs this loan to buy another dairy cow. His goal is to work producing and selling milk in order to have enough spare time to build a house. His dream is to finish building his own house, because the house where he lives belongs to his cousin. He has a big family and the house is small. He also wants to have his own dairy product business.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase soda, beer, washing detergent, and sugar to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Carmel Joy

texts.en:
Carmel Joy is a married mother of 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 50 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Carmel Joy has a personal care products business in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more stock of personal care products to sell.

Carmel Joy has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Karla Yasmin

texts.es:
Karla, de 29 años de edad, es bachiller, está casada y ambos son empleados de una ONG, no tienen hijos y viven en una casa alquilada.

Karla, es empleada desde hace un año, anteriormente se dedicaba a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, este negocio lo mantuvo por más de 8 años, ella viaja en autobús hacia su trabajo todos los días y las comunidades que atiende están como a 1 hora y media en autobús y trabaja de lunes a viernes de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una plancha de hacer pupusas, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes, pero los sábados y los domingos quiere continuar con el negocio de las pupusas, ya que en la zona no hay mucha competencia y hay bastante demanda. 

Ella sueña con tener hijos, tener su propia casa, mantener su empleo y en futuro tener más empleados.
texts.en:
Karla is 29 years old and is a high school graduate. She is married and both she and her husband are employed by an NGO (non-governmental organization). They don't have any children and live in a rented house.

Karla has been employed for a year. Previously, she made and sold ‘pupusas’ (stuffed tortillas). She had this business for over 8 years. Karla travels by bus to her job every day and the communities she serves are about an hour and a half away by bus. She works Monday through Friday from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

Karla needs this loan to buy a griddle for pupusas. She works Monday through Friday, but on Saturday and Sunday she wants to continue with her pupusa business since there isn't much competition in the area and there is quite a demand. Karla dreams of having children, having her own house, keeping her job, and having employees in the future.

loans.use: to buy a griddle to make ‘pupusas’ (stuffed tortillas).

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is an active woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1994. She lives in a remote district in a small town with her family. She is divorced and has one child. Her parents gave her away in marriage when she was young. However, after divorcing, she felt difficulties in raising her child alone.

Mahbuba started her own tailoring business in order to support her child. She wants to ensure her baby has all the necessities in life. 

Mahbuba sews traditional women's dresses and has a permanent clientele. She lives with her parents and helps them with their cost of living. She also wants to help and support her brother so he can go to Russia and find a job. Their family is poor, and her brother's earnings from Russia would give them all a better standard of living. 

Mahbuba has requested a loan from Kiva's lenders so she can buy a ticket to Russia for her brother. It will help give her family the opportunity to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy her brother a ticket to Russia, giving her family a chance at a better standard of living.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard used his previous loan to buy general merchandise, such as sugar and maize, to sell. He is still in Kamwenge, Uganda, where he operates a retail shop and also earns extra income from agriculture. This helps him look after his family and pay school fees his children.

His main hardships are high taxes, inadequate capital, and competition from other traders. Nevertheless, he intends to work hard to attain his goals of expanding his business to new markets and buying land to grow crops.

Richard is requesting a loan to buy more general merchandise, such as bread, sugar and soap, to sell.

loans.use: to buy more general merchandise, such as bread, sugar and soap, to sell.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a hard-working 65-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer and supplements his income from his salary and three mobile money outlets. With this, he has been able to generate income to sustain his family. He desires to buy a pickup vehicle to enable him to easily transport his bananas and coffee to various markets. He, however, has a challenge in the price fluctuations of agricultural produce. 

He is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his garden.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim lives in Kamwenge, Uganda and used a previous loan to hire laborers to harvest coffee. Now he earns most of his income by growing bananas, coffee, watermelon and beans. He started these businesses in order to improve his standard of living. His main challenges are pests, disease and price fluctuations, Despite this, he hopes to expand and improve his farm. Ibrahim is requesting a loan to buy seeds to plant this season.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant this season.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, ya que desde muy temprana edad le enseñaron a trabajar, porque en su familia era grande y no alcanzaban los recursos para que él pudiera estudiar, está acompañado, tiene dos hijos.

Mauricio, se dedica a la agricultura, ya que ese fue el trabajo que aprendió de su padre.

Mauricio, necesita el dinero para comprar abono, veneno y semilla para el cultivo de sandía, ya que en esta área cuenta con mucha experiencia y siempre obtiene ganancia. 

A Mauricio, le gustaría que sus hijos tengan lo necesario para vivir bien, pero lo que más le gustaría es tener su propia casa, para que sus hijos no anden alquilando.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 34 years old, studied until the first grade. They taught him to work from a very young age, because he was the oldest in his family, and there were not enough resources for him to study. He is in a relationship and has two children.

Mauricio makes a living in agriculture, since this was the trade he learned from his father. Mauricio needs money to buy compost, poison, and seeds for the watermelon crop, since he has a lot of experience in this area and always makes a profit.

Mauricio would like his children to have what they need to live well. What he would like the most is to have his own house, so that his children don't have to rent.

loans.use: to buy compost, poison, and seeds for the watermelon crop.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, de 23 años de edad, está estudiando en la universidad, está soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres y trabaja medio turno. 

Flor, es empleada en una farmacia desde hace 3 años, tuvo la necesidad de buscar un empleo para poder pagar sus estudios universitarios, ya que en su trabajo le dan permiso de poder estudiar. 

El préstamo lo necesita para pagar la matrícula, las mensualidades de la universidad y para comprar unos libros que necesita tener. 

Ella sueña con terminar su carrera universitaria y graduarse como Licenciada en Laboratorio Clínico y tener su propio laboratorio.
texts.en:
Flor, 23, is studying at college. She is single and doesn't have any children. She lives at her parents house and works part time.

Flor has been employed at a pharmacy for 3 years. She needed to look for work in order to pay for college because at her job, they give her permission to study.

Flor needs this loan to pay for tuition, monthly university fees, and to buy some books she needs to have. She dreams of finishing her university degree, graduating with a Bachelor of Clinical Laboratory Science, and having her own lab.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, monthly university fees, and to buy some books she needs to have.

loans.name: Vitumbiko Group

texts.en: Bera is 38 years old, married and the mother of two children. Because she wanted to lift her family out of poverty, she went into the business of selling secondhand clothes to people in her community. She started her business in order to pay her children's school fees and medical bills. She will use this loan to expand her business by buying more bales of secondhand clothes to sell. With the help of a loan she obtained in previous years, she was able to provide for the basic needs of her children without facing any difficulties.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and construct a better enclosure.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.pt:
A senhora Felicia  de 30 anos de idade e solteira  mae de 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino primario e  o outro frequenta o ensino secundário , tem um irmão na sua responsabilidade, vive em casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar: cimento, ferro, arrame, pregos, barrotes, vidros, chapas de cobertura para dar continuidade  da sua obra.
Tem como sonho concluir a sua casa , para oferecer um lar melhor a sua casa.
Os principais desafios são financeiros tem recorrido ao xitique, e pretende tomar mais vezes para reforcar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Felicia is 30 years old and single. She has two children, of which one attends primary school and one attends secondary school. She's responsible for her brother and she lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she intends to purchase cement, iron, wire, nails, beams, glass, and roof plates so that she can continue the construction work.
Her dream is to finish her house so she can provide a better home for her family.
Her main challenges are financial. She has been using rotating credit, and she intends to get other loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, wire, nails, beams, glass, and roof plates so that she can continue the construction work.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Fatu. She is married, and has one child aged 36 years. She has two additional dependents who live with her to be fostered.

In 2006, Fatu established her cooking utensil business after dropping out of school due to the lack of financial support from her parents. Women were not encouraged to further their education at that time, so her alternative was to start doing business. She started trading in local produce and was able to save 40,000 SLL which she used to purchase household utensils to sell from home. Within the year, she rented another stall in town to display her stock in larger quantity. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 7,355,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 6,000,000. 

Fatu has already received and successfully repaid six loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cartons of enamel pans, bowls etc. She has started her building project of her house and a store outlet to have her own business premises as previously planned. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of enamel pans, bowls etc.

loans.name: 15 Thành Lập Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and the main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Hà is the group leader of the 15 Thành Lập Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of four members. This is her first loan with the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Hà is 45 years old, and she is married with three children. With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and hopes to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Jeramie

texts.en:
Jeramie lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 27 years old and has three young dependents. She earns a living by making and selling native pots made of clay and a mixture of cement. In addition to that, she also runs a sari-sari (or variety) store. She sells assorted goods like canned goods, sugar, cooking oil,noodles, seasonings and toiletries. She has been in this business for the last five years. 

Jeramie is asking for a loan to buy materials for her pottery business and additional items to sell in her store. By making more pots, she can attract more buyers, increase her sales and earn more money. In the future, she is committed to manage both of her business successfully in order to improve her family's living conditions and lead a better and more sustainable life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her pottery business and additional items for her store

loans.name: Nurcihan

texts.en:
Nurcihan is married with three children. She runs a cleaning company. She provides cleaning services to private homes and companies. She also does ship cleaning. She loves cleaning and believes that she can always find a job in the cleaning sector. At first, Nurcihan was also joining a cleaning team. With her third loan, she will buy more cleaning products. She aims to be strong and one of the preferred companies in this sector.  

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Nurcihan Hanım evli ve üç çocuk annesi.  Temizlik şirketi işletiyor.  Ev temizliklerine, kurumsal firmalarında genel temizliğine elemanları ile temizliğe  gidiyor.  Tersanelerde ki gemilerin genel temizliğini de alıp yapıyor.  Bu işe can sıkıntısından girdiğini söylüyor.  Temizlik yapmayı çok sevdiğinden ve bu sektörde sürekli iş bulacağını bildiğinden  bu işe başlıyor.  İlk zamanlar kendisi de temizliğe gidiyor.  Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile temizlik malzemeleri alacak.  Aranan bir numara bir firma olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino de 55 años de edad, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales dependen de él, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y le ayuda en las laboras agrícolas.

Marcelino es agricultor y ganadero, él ordeña vacas y elabora derivados de la leche que le sirven para vender y para consumo familiar.
 
Él necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca para que le provea leche y vender sus derivados.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos estables, llevando una vida agradable y siempre trabajar para que no les falte nada a su esposa.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 55 years of age, is married and has 3 children who depend on him. His wife does domestic work and helps him with farming. Marcelino is a farmer and rancher. He milks cows and makes by-products from the milk that he is able to sell and use at home.

He needs the loan to buy a cow that to provide him with milk and so that he can sell the by-products.

His dream is to see his children settled, living a comfortable life, and to always work so that his wife doesn't want for anything.

loans.use: to buy a cow to give him milk and so that he can sell the by-products.

loans.name: Ponsiano

texts.en: Ponsiano is a new client and applying for a loan of UGX.1,500,000. He is 37 years old, married, the father of three children and works as a pastor of a local church. Hie dream has been to get a plot of land and build a house for his family, but he did not have enough money to do that. Luck came his way after a neighbor offered to sell him land with a house already on it, but he was puzzled about how to could get all he money he needed.  He approached a Ugafode branch in Rukungiri and after getting a loan he went away a happy man because his dream came true. He thanks UGAFODE for its tremendous financial support and making his dream come true. Thank you Kiva lenders for being willing to lend to Ponsiano.

loans.use: to buy more land.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en: Mehriniso is a hospitable woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is living in a small village with her family. She is married and has three children. She has 20 years of experience doing business. She opened a small grocery store nearby her house. Her children are also helping her to do business because it is close to her house. The income that she earns she spends on her family needs like clothing and food. Mehriniso knows her activity well and serves each customer gently and nicely. She is well known among friends and neighbors for her honesty, kindness and patience. She asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy additional grocery products, because her assortment is at the end. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery products, because her assortment is at the end.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is widowed and has three children. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to hire laborers to weed his banana and coffee plantation. He earns additional income from selling and sewing second-hand clothes. He started his businesses with the intention of improving his standard of living and looking after his children. His main challenges are pests and diseases and competition from other traders.

Caleb requested a loan, which he will use to to buy seeds for planting this season. He hopes to improve the quality and increase the output level of bananas produced from his farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming activity by employing modern farming techniques for more income and to improve family living standards.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 21 years old. He lives in Batumi with his aunt and her family. Giorgi's parents also live in Batumi and are involved in agricultural activities. Giorgi decided to live with her aunt and work there. 

Giorgi is an artisan and has opened a workshop, where with his friends he repairs phones. He requested a loan from the start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, for $650, which he will use to purchase new equipment to repair phone screens. He will be able to get more orders and repair more phones and thus increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment to repair phone screens

loans.name: Wendsongda Villa Group

texts.fr:
Madame FATI  est responsable du groupe WENDSONGDA VILLA. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21 ans et le moins âgé a 08 ans. 05 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 17 personnes en charge.
Madame fait de l’agriculture depuis 30 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Elle compte acheter avec l’argent octroyé, 10 sacs de noyaux et 40 sacs de céréales.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour ouvrir sa propre boutique et épargner. Elle ambitionne ouvrir sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
Madame Fati is the leader of the group called Wendsongda Villa. She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 21 and the youngest eight years old. Five of her children attend school, and she is responsible for 17 persons.   

Madame Fati has been in agriculture for 30 years. She buys her supplies in the surrounding markets. 

With the loan amount, she intends to buy 10 sacks of nuts and 40 sacks of cereals. She wants to use the profit from the loan to open her own little shop and to put aside savings. Her ambition is to open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of nuts and 40 sacks of cereals with the loan amount

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 38 years old and a good cattle keeper. He lives in Embaare, Kikatsi, rural Kiruhura- a neighbouring district to Mbarara. He lives with his family of six children. Godfrey never went to school, but he is educating all his children in good schools with earnings from his cows. 

What is interesting about this gentleman is that during dry season he has boreholes, so he fetches water from the nearby river stream and feeds his cows thus having good production through out the season. Godfrey gets money from milk production and by selling some cows. He requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more cows for fattening and later sell.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical expenses for his son, who is very ill in Lui Hospital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and get more milk to supply

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Fifty-three-year-old Amalia earns a living by selling fresh fish to the locals in her place. She is a married woman with twelve children, from Talibon, Bohol. Six of her children are still attending school.

Amalia has requested a loan to buy a variety of fresh fish. This will bring Amalia's livelihood back to life again. With this, she could purchase various kinds of fresh fish to be sold to her respective customers. Thus, it will enable her to provide her family with a nutritious diet and better living conditions.

She hopes that she could handle her business successfully to become productive and be able to continue to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic products

loans.name: Luz Monica

texts.es: Luz tiene 28 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en Salinas Provincia de Bolivar, Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, solicita el credito para comprar una vaca pequeña, gracias a este credito que es una ayuda rapita podra incrementar su negocio y mejorarlo, ella compra en Guaranda en el mercado de animales cada semana, su sueño es que su hija tenga una buena educación, en su tiempo libre le gusta pasear con su esposo e hija.
texts.en: Luz is 28 years old, married, and has an 11-year-old child. She lives with her husband and child in Salinas, Bolivar province. She works buying and selling cows. She asks for the loan to purchase a small cow. Thanks to this loan that is a quick help, she will be able to increase her business and improve it. She makes her purchases in Guaranda in the animal market each week. Her dream is that her daughter has a good education. She likes to spend her free time with her husband and daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a small cow.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr:
Lucie est une femme dynamique. Même à son âge (59ans), elle  veut  dépendre de personne, elle  veut être une charge de personne. C'est la raison pour laquelle, elle travaille toujours.
Elle est veuve et a 7 grands enfants dont les cinq sont déjà mariés et les deux derniers, encore célibataires, mais ayant leurs  propre emplois, habitent avec elle.
Lucie était auparavant femme de ménage à la campagne, sa famille y habitait.En 2012, à cause des études dudit deux derniers enfants, elle a dû arrêter et les accompagner dans la capitale pour les soutenir dans leurs études.  Alors, il fallait qu'elle y trouve une source de revenu pour survivre et c'est là que lui vienne l'idée de créer un point d'appel téléphonique ou "taxi-phone". C'est une femme très débrouillarde.
Son désire d'offrir une vie meilleur et de faire réussir ses enfants dans la vie lui poussait et encore à continuer à lutter et avancer. Elle mérite un petit coup de pouce.
texts.en:
Lucie is a dynamic woman. Even at her age of 59, she doesn't want to have to depend on anyone or have anyone take care of her. It is for this reason that she is always working. 

Lucie is a widow and has seven grown children, of whom five are already married. The other two are still single, but they have proper employment and live with her.

Previously, Lucie was a maid in the countryside and her family lived there. But then in 2012, because of her youngest two children's studies, she stopped being a maid and accompanied her children to the capital to help support them in their studies. Then she had to find a source of income so that she could survive, and it was then that she came up with the idea to create a phone kiosk, or a "phone taxi."

This woman is resourceful. Her wish to offer a better life to her children and to help them succeed has pushed her and she continues to advance. She deserves a little boost.

loans.use: to buy Telma, Orange, and Airtel phone recharge cards, some SIM cards, and two mobile phones

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr:
Martine possède un magasin de quincaillerie. Elle a démarré en 2010. Avant, elle s'adonnait à une épicerie, mais elle trouve que la marge bénéficiaire dans la quincaillerie est beaucoup plus intéressant et en plus il n'y a pas encore de concurrents dans le quartier où elle habite.
Le prêt va être utilisé pour acheter des sacs de ciments. C'est l'approvisionnement en ciment qui lui est un peu difficile. De ce fait,elle désire acquérir une camionnette ou expresse pour faciliter l'appro. Ceci va lui permettre de gagner du temps et aussi de l'argent.
Martine a 34 ans. Elle est mariée (Son mari est maçon). Elle est mère de quatre enfants âgés de 13,13,8,et 6ans. Ils vont tous actuellement à l'école.
texts.en:
Martine owns a hardware store, which she started in 2010. Before she worked in a grocery store, but she found that the profit margin with a hardware store is more interesting and plus, there is no competition in the village.

This loan is going to be used to buy bags of cement, which are a bit difficult to acquire. She must find a truck or a van to facilitate the transport. This will allow her to save time and also money.

Martine is 34 years old. She is married to a mason. She is the mother of four children, aged 13, 13, 8, and 6. All the children go to school.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, 26 years old, is newly married and a father of one.  He is a rural agriculturalist who thrives on cattle keeping and trade. He loves his business but gets challenged by the high cost of the cows, which requires him to have capital that he does not possess. He is, therefore, forced to look for alternative sources from UGADOE Microfinance, an institution that lends to the rural poor. He appreciates the fact that UGAFODE is willing to support his business despite his lack of collateral security since he hasn't accumulated enough money to acquire assets.

He is hardworking and resilient and pledges to pay well to maintain the good relationship between him and UGAFODE in partnership with the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To boost his business by buying cattle to trade

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en: Nazakat is married with three children. She lives in Baku region. This is Nazakat's second loan. The first loan she closed on time. Now Nazakat is in the poultry business. She earns money by selling eggs and chickens to regular customer neighbors. Today she wants to increase her business and has applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 2000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan she wants to buy more chickens to grow and to sell for gain. She says great thanks to the Kiva organization and all the lenders for aid. In the future Nazakat wants to have a poultry enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and increase business. In the future she wants to have a poultry enterprise.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia hails from the town of Antequera, Bohol. She is a 60-year-old married woman with five grown children. She engages in a food vending business. She prepares and sells snack food like suman (glutinous rice cakes), puto (rice cakes), ice candy and pancakes. She has been engaged in this kind of business for three years now.

Anastacia is in need of funds to continue operating her food vending business. She is asking for a loan to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar and cooking oil. These ingredients will be used in preparing variety of snack food. Thus, her daily earnings will slowly improve and enable her to set aside some savings.

She hopes that she will become productive in handling her business to attain better living conditions in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: Aziza is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is living in town with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. She has many years of practice doing business in the domestic market. She started by sewing traditional women's dresses and selling them in the market. At the time side by side she did business in the domestic market. Recently she sells kids' clothing. However, she needs money to buy a new assortment of kids' clothes to sell. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy kids' clothes. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of kids' clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gülsüm

texts.en:
She is retired and lives with her mom. She is selling Tupperware products. She started this business with a friend's recommendation to kill time and make some money. She says she found a different social circle with this new business and is pleased with it. With the loan she will buy more Tupperware kitchen products. Her dream is to have a healthy life.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.
Gülsüm hanım emekli, annesi ile birlikte yaşıyor. Tupperware ürün satışı yapıyor. Emekli olduktan sonra bir arkadaşının önerisi ile hem boş vakitlerini geçirmek hem de maddi kazanç sağlamak amacı ile başlıyor. Bu işle değişik bir çevreye sahip olduğunu bundan da memnun olduğunu söyledi. Aldığı kredi ile Tupperware (mutfak eşyaları)ürünleri alacak. Hayali sağlıklı bir yaşam.

loans.use: to buy more Tupperware kitchen products

loans.name: Edilza Del Carmen

texts.es: Edilza de 59 años de edad se dedica al oficio de la confección desde hace 25 años, pues trabajaba como operaria en una fábrica y cuado esta cerró sus puertas, entregó a sus empleados los activos fijos y los negocios y como tenia una gran expereincia en el oficio decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios en lo que ya conocia. Sus líneas de producto son la ropa para damas, caballeros e infantil, ella pide a su clientela el 50% del valor de la prenda para dar inicio a su trabajo, pues sostiene contratos con entidades de educación y personas referídas por la clientela fija, que ha construido durante largo tioemnpo. En la actualidad, está apicando a unc reidkiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará tela, hilo, botones, accesorios para hacer un terminado de calidad, con esta inversión sus ventas aumentarán por concepto de ingresos y esto es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Edilza, 59 years old, has worked as a seamstress for the past 25 years. She worked as an employee in a factory and when this closed its doors, it gave its employees the fixed assets and the businesses and it became like a great experience in work. She decided to open her own business adventure in the field she already knew. Her production lines are women's, men's and children's clothing. She asks her customers for 50% of the value of the order to start her work, and she has contracts with educational entities and people referred to her by the regular customer base, which she has built up over a long time. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she is taking from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase fabric, thread, buttons, and accessories to have a quality finish. With this investment, her sales with increase and also the income, and this is precisely the success of a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, and accessories.

loans.name: Dieudonnee

texts.en:
Dieudonnee is 39 years old. He is married with three children aged between 7 and 11 years old, They all go to school. He is a farmer and has been growing rice for the past ten years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer. He will use the profits from the business  to pay school fees for his children and to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional sand and ballast for use in work

loans.name: Patrice

texts.en:
Patrice is a married man, aged 27 years, with two children who are young. He lives in a rural setting with his family. He deals in agriculture mainly growing of bananas, and he supplements his family income with produce sales especially sale of coffee. He works seven days a week and each day he works for 14 hours. He started his business in 2009 with the aim of getting money to increase the family income. 

He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy farm inputs of fertilizers and herbicides for his banana and coffee plantation. His clients are traders from surrounding towns.  His dream is to be the leading producer of coffee in his area, but his biggest challenge is lack of enough capital, which he no longer fears, since UGAFODE and Kiva lenders are committed to help him overcome this through financial boosts. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to spread in his banana plantation to boost the yields.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man, aged 32, with 4 children and two dependents. He lives in a rural area with the family and deals in cattle keeping as well as trading. He rears mainly the local type which is resistant to the harsh sunshine and diseases. He also does small scale farming to feed the family and sells the surplus to boost the family income. 

James has been in this type of agriculture since his early childhood, as this is his ancestral occupation. He works all 7 days of the week,12 hours per day. He started the business to improve the family income and to have tuition for his growing children.

He is acquiring the loan to purchase more cows for the business. His clients are traders that sell the cows to the city abattoir (slaughterhouse). His hope for the future is to be the leading supplier of cows in his home village and the challenge he faces is poor weather condition leading to poor pastures. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man encouraging lenders to continue supporting the low income earners.

loans.use: To boost his cattle business by buying cattle for trading purposes

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a current borrower with the institution, applying for ugx.2,000,000. She is a resident of Nansana, a city suburb. Jackline is a single mother of two children and a dependent that she has managed to educate and feed using her savings.

She has been in the charcoal business for two years and has now accumulated enough savings to start a spare parts shop - a business that she has always dreamed of. She is assured of clients because of the many automobiles around town. She knows she will build a large client base to boost her sales. 

She is borrowing to buy a stock of the spare parts to sell, since her capital is still insufficient.

She is very grateful to the funders for supporting people like her in achieving their dreams; her future goal is to expand her business and employ other people. She is hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: To buy a stock of spare parts to sell to sell

loans.name: Mukisa Development Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. She is a married woman with children, and a businesswoman who owns a boutique that sells mainly ladies wear. She joined Mukisa group recently in order for her to access funds through group guarantee since she has but a small business and no collateral. 

Sara has applied for a loan of ugx.400,000 to add stock to her business which will also increase her income. 

She is very grateful to UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders for the financial support given to her and fellow group members; she has no doubt they will advance in their businesses.

She is hard working and innovative since she has to keep buying nice designs that will attract customers.

loans.use: to add stock to her clothing business

loans.name: Mazima Development Group Kiyembe

texts.en:
Dinah is a new client with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd.  

She applied for a loan of ugx500,000 through her group of fellow low income earners to increase her working capital. She is a married woman with children.

She is a businesswoman selling jewelry. 

In a bid to increase her working capital /expand the business, she has applied for a loan of 500,000 to help her boost her jewelry business that has high demand in the local market. She is, however, faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital, which forces her to buy in small quantities, therefore affecting her profitability.

She is very grateful for the support from Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business.

Dinah and the group members commend the good job done by UGAFODE Microfinance.

loans.use: to boost business by buying jewelry to sell

loans.name: Crusade Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of a loan group called Crusade. The group members live in Accra-chorkor where they sell cooking oil, rice, plantain and cassava. Beatrice is the group representative.

Beatrice is 47 years old, married and has three children who are all in school. For the past 28 years, Beatrice has been selling cooking oil and rice. She is in her seventh loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

Beatrice is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil and rice to sell and increase her income. In the coming years, she would like to open up a large store and see her children educated.i

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and rice to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Pacifica

texts.en:
Pacifica is 45 years old, and she supports five family members. She has been selling clothes in the market for the last 15 years, and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 12,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she plans to use to purchase additional bales of second hand clothes for sale to her customers in the market.

She plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children.

Her hope is to be financially stable and be the preferred seller of clothes in the market.

loans.use: to purchase additional bales of second hand clothes for sale to her customers in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase general merchandise for his retail shop

loans.name: Fathi

texts.en:
Fathi is a 36-year-old married man from Rafah city. He works as an employee in the public sector. Fathi gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs. Fathi would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy all that they need.

Fathi took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.
Fathi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Raulance

texts.en:
Raulance is a 36-year-old hardworking married man with five children, age 12, 10, 8, 6 and 4 years old, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He has been able to earn a living and look after his family from his produce business where he buys and sells coffee. He also earns more income from his side business of a coffee farm and machine plus cattle keeping. 

He is optimistic of having a big coffee plantation and educated children; however, he has been limited by weather changes and price fluctuations. 

He is requesting for a loan to buy more bags of coffee to sell.

The photo shows Raulance's other source of income.

loans.use: to buy more bags of coffee to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her farming through application of modern farming technologies

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa with the intentions of benefiting from savings mobilization and financial management training. He is 32 years old, married ,and a father of two children.

He is a vegetable farmer and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and certified seeds. This will increase production of vegetables, hence increased income to better cater for his family's expenses. 

He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and certified seeds to increase the production of vegetables, hence increased income to better cater for his family's expenses.

loans.name: David

texts.en: Rev. David is an old client of the institution who is applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. The happily married reverend is aged 64 years old and has six children. He hails from Rushaka, Nyabiteete, Buyanja subcounty, Rukungiri district. David works as an archdeacon of the Rubirizi, North Kigezi diocese. In addition to his job as a pastor, he is also in agriculture, majoring in banana growing. Since he is approaching retirement, his dream has been the expansion and improvement of his banana plantation but the challenge has been limited capital to buy manure and any other fertilizers. He hopes this loan will enable him to make the necessary improvement in his agriculture and increase his income in those days of retirement.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN  JOVEN TRABAJADOR QUIEN APOYA A SUS PADRES CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR, DESDE HACE MUCHO TIEMPO TIENE PROBLEMAS EN SU VISTA, ESTO HA SIDO UN FACTOR NEGATIVO PARA SEGUIR CON SU VIDA DIARIA. ACTUALMENTE NECESITA SOMETERSE A UN TRATAMIENTOO Y POSTERIORMENTE A UNA CIRUGIA QUE LE AYUDE A MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en: This hardworking young man helps his parents with the household expenses.  He has experienced vision problems for quite some time and his condition has been a negative factor that continues to hinder his daily life.  He currently needs to undergo treatment, so he plans to have surgery in order to help improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Margaret. She joined join Hand in Hand in 2014 to benefit from the training, especially on savings mobilization and enterprise development. She is 42 years old, married, and blessed with four children. 

She is a vegetable farmer, and besides that, she sells second hand clothes. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more clothes to add stock to her second hand selling business. She will then increase her sales and earn more income to cater for her family expenses with ease.

She is much grateful to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add stock to her second hand selling business so as to increase her sales and earn more income to meet her family's expenses.

loans.name: Gulhumor

texts.ru:
Это Гулхумор. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Ей 43 лет. Гулхумор жительница района Гиссар. Ее муж в настоящее время находится вдали от семьи – он на заработках в городе Российской Федерации, и каждый месяц отправляет им деньги, чтобы обеспечить семью. 
Гулхумор дома занимается шитьем женской одежды более 3 года. Она профессионал своей работе. Гулхумор хорошо справляется со своей работой. Своей работе ей нравится больше сшить. Она решила взять кредит и отремонтировать дом. За счет кредита Гулхумор намерена приобрести строй материалы.  Гулхумор несколько лет копила деньги на ремонт. Она была очень расстроена признав, что ее денег не хватит для завершения ремонта и для нее единственный выход получения кредита.
texts.en:
This is Gulhumor. She is married, and a mother of three. She is 43 years old. She lives in the region of Gissar. Her husband is away from home earning money in a city in the Russian Federation. He sends money back home every month to provide for his family. 

Gulhumor has been in the business of sewing women's clothing for more than 3 years. She is a professional. About her work, she enjoys sewing as much as possible. She decided to take a loan and renovate her house. With the loan, Gulhumor is planning to buy construction materials. She has been saving money for renovations for several years. She was very sad when she realized the money she’d saved wasn’t enough to finish the renovations, and borrowing is the only way out for her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and renovate her house

loans.name: Jhosly Mateo

texts.es: JHOSLY MATEO:Es un joven cordial, de la comunidad de Saupuka, que se localiza a 8 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam, pertenece a la etnia mayagna, tiene 27 años de edad, casado, tiene un pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad. Con gran esfuerzo poco a poco ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de tambo y madera, sin embargo con su salario no le cubre para realizarle algunas mejoras como terminar de techar su vivienda. Es por eso que solicitan su primer préstamo para comprar: zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. El sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jhosly Mateo is a friendly young man who is from the community of Saupuka, which is located eight kilometers from the municipality of Waspam. He is 27 years old, married, and of Mayangna ethnicity. Jhosly has a five-year-old son.

With great effort over time, he was able to begin construction on his wooden stilt house. However, his salary is not enough to cover some of the improvements, such as finishing the roof of his home. For this reason, Jhosly is requesting his first loan in order to buy zinc sheets and nails, as well as cover the cost of labor. His dream is to have a beautiful home with better and safer conditions, as well as a better living space for his children.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to finish the roof of his wooden stilt house.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 38-year-old married man from Rafah city. He works as an employee in the public sector. He gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs. He would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy all that they need.

Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 47 years old. He has been married for 25 years and has two children. The elder of them is studying the second course of college, and another has graduated school and learned the car master profession. Musa lives in the Baku region. 

Musa has been in the repair/construction business for 16 years and loves his job. Today, Musa wants to increase his business, so he has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat) to repair a necessary apparatus for his work. 

Musa says, “Dear Kiva organization and dear lender, you helped me a lot.”

loans.use: to repair apparatus and increase business, helping him to provide his children with education.

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is 59 years old. She is married with two children aged between 18 and 22 years, and they both go to school.

Floride is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 10 years.  Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more machines for use in his shop for efficient service to clients

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun is a 41-year-old widowed factory worker with three children, and she has worked in the factory since 2011. All of them live in Kandal Province in Cambodia. One of her children is a construction worker and two attend school. Together, they can earn around $10 each day. 

Sarun lacks the finances to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work and for family use, therefore she would like to request a loan. With the motorcycle from the loan, she and her family will be able to have better traveling conditions and reduce traveling expenses. 

As for her future plans, Sarun is going to save money to build a proper house and support her children in finishing high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work and for family use

loans.name: Yenny Erlinda

texts.es:
Yenny, de 38 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es madre soltera y vive con sus cuatro hijas.

Yenny, trabaja como empleada doméstica por las mañanas y por las tardes hace venta de comida típica, sus hijas le ayudan y salen a vender la comida. 

Ella necesita el dinero para reparar el  techo de su casa, ya que se acerca el invierno y no quiere que sus cosas se mojen. 

Su sueño siempre ha sido, tener una familia completa, además espera sacar adelante a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Yenny, 38, wasn't able to go to school.  She's a single mother who lives with her four daughters.

Yenny works as a housekeeper in the morning and sells traditional food in the afternoon.  Her daughters help her and they go out to sell the food.

She needs the money to repair the roof of her house, because winter's approaching and she doesn't want her belongings to get wet.

Yenny's dream has always been to have a complete family.  She also hopes to get her daughters ahead.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase crates of soda and cooking oil for sale to his clients who have increased in number

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 28-year-old single man from the city of Khan Younis. He works as an employee in the public sector. Mahmoud receives a low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs. Mahmoud would like to improve his family living conditions and buy all that they need.

Mahmoud took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Матлуба уроженка района Гиссар. Она бизнес-леди. Матлуба занимается продажей огурцы и помидоры на рынке. Она 5 год своей жизни занята с торговлей. Матлуба уже опытная женщина. Бизнесом она хорошо справляется. 
Матлуба замужняя женщина. Ей 38 лет. У нее двое детей. Дети учатся в средней школе. Ей в работе помогает ее муж. Матлуба хочет расширить деятельность и увеличить ежедневный доход. Она просит кредит, для перевоза больше овощей на продажу.  Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей расширить деятельность и увеличить доход.
texts.en:
Matluba was born in the Gissar region. She is a business woman. She sells cucumbers and tomatoes at the market. After five years in business, she has a lot of experience and manages well.

Matluba is married. She is 38 years old. She has two children, both in secondary school. Her husband helps her in her work. Matluba would like to expand her business and increase her daily revenues. She is applying for a loan to transport more vegetables for resale. This loan will allow her to expand her business and increase her revenues.

loans.use: to stock up on vegetables  and expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Leonel Alberto

texts.es:
Leonel, de 53 años de edad, solo estudio hasta tercer grado y es agricultor, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos, todos viven con él. 

Leonel, aparte de la agricultura, trabaja en una hacienda en donde cultiva marañón; se ha dedicado a este trabajo desde hace cinco años, ya que se le dio la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos. 

Leonel, necesita el dinero para comprar abono, veneno y pagar mano de obra para trabajar en la agricultura. 

Sus sueños son mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Leonel is 53 years old and only studied to the 3rd grade. He is a farmer with a wife and three children who live with him.

In addition to being a farmer, Leonel works on a large hacienda, tending to cashew trees. He took this job some five years ago, since it gave him the opportunity to earn a better income.

Leonel needs funds to purchase manure and insecticides and to pay for laborers to work on his crops.

His dream is to improve his economic situation.

loans.use: to purchase manure and insecticides and to pay laborers to tend his crops.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 28 years old and supports eight family members. He has been in business running a general store for the last seven years, and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 13,000.

Peter has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stock of household goods for his business for more income gain. He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and to educate his children.

His future hopes and dreams include being financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods for his business to gain more income

loans.name: Genda

texts.en:
Genda is a married woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of three children, aged 10, 8, and 5 years. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells basic commodities ranging from biscuits to powdered milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and toiletries. She also raises and sells hogs for extra income.

Genda has requested a loan for 30,000 PHP to buy assorted stock for the store and hog feed. These items are very important for bringing her business back to life: she will be able to display a variety of goods to attract more customers and, because she raises and sells hogs, it will supplement her income and allow her to expand her business.

In the future, she hopes to manage her sources of income successfully.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock for her variety store as well as hog feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a pruning machine and sprays to kill insects that bite the plants making the produce poor, to get a better harvest in the future.

loans.name: María Jorge

texts.es:
María de 64 años de edad, es una mujer campesina que vive con sus hijos y 3 nietos, dedicada a su hogar y encargada de mantener a su familia.

María tiene más de  25 años de dedicarse a la producción agrícola, sembrando maíz y frijol, una parte para vender u otra para consumo familiar, ella sabe mucho de este rubro y por eso tiene bastantes años sacando buenos cultivos.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, venenos, insecticidas, etc. para lograr una buena cosecha de maíz y frijol.

Ella espera que la cosecha le dé muchos frutos deseando que sus hijos le ayuden en la venta.
texts.en:
Maria is 64 years old.  She is a country woman who lives with her children and 3 grandchildren.  She works at household tasks and also takes care of maintaining her family.

Maria has worked for more than 25 years in agriculture, growing corn and beans, some of which she sells and some of which is consumed by the family. She knows a lot about this line of work and thus has had many years with good crops.

She needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides etc. in order to achieve a good harvest of corn and beans.

She hopes that the harvest will give much produce, and that her children help in the sale of it.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides etc. to achieve a good harvest of corn and beans

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 20-year-old lady, born fourth in a family of five. She is in her third year studying for her bachelor's in business administration at Moi University, specializing in Marketing. 

Ann finished the Junior Achievement Company Program in 2013. Through the entrepreneurial skills she obtained in the program, Ann saw an opportunity to provide various services to the students at Moi University, Odera Akang’o Campus. The services include a canteen and photocopying. The business is located in the school so there is a ready market for all the services provided. 

Ann has already obtained the permit from the school administration. She is looking forward to obtaining her first loan from Kiva in order to obtain an M-Pesa (mobile money transfer services) line and floating money.

loans.use: to buy more stock and obtain an M-Pesa line (for mobile money transfer) and float money.

loans.name: Yoeuk's Group

texts.en: Yoeuk is 58 years old, is a married mother of seven children, and lives in Battambang province. Rice farming, working for another farm and feeding cows have been the sources of her family’s income for more than five years. Due to lack of funds, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund in order to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more cows. She hopes her business will be expanded through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en:
Parvina is a skillful woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1988. She lives in a small town with her family. She is a widow. She has five years of experience of doing business.
