Bashiran is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires, along with auto spare parts for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his motorcycle business for more income and to improve his family's living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family home

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia Sonia se sigue dedicando al trabajo en un hotel,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia,la socia ya tiene varios años trabajando en un hotel,el sueño de la socia es terminar de estudiar turismo.La socia solicita el credito para comprarse un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sonia still works in a hotel. Through this business, she wants to get her family ahead. She has been working in the hotel for some years. Her dream is to finish studying tourism. She asks for the loan to purchase a television for her house.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase a television for her house.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Maria Isabel se sigue dedicando al negocio de salon de belleza,la socia realiza cortes de cabello,tintes y ondulaciones,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de salon de belleza.La socia solicita le credito para comprar tintes y tijeras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel continues working in the beauty salon business. She does cuts, dyes, and perms. She, through this business, wants to continue onward.  Her dream is to expand her beauty salon business. She asks for the loan to purchase dyes and scissors.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase dyes and scissors.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 37-year-old married woman.  

Shamim deals in a business selling animals along with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Shamim needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. 

With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is a 42-year-old hardworking woman who has three children. 

Hanifa has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. When she started working, Hanifa’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Hanifa has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and lace to meet the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and lace for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is aged 58 years. She is married with two children aged between 18 and 21 years who both go to school. 

Speciose is a farmer and she has been in a business for the past 10 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and to pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Rayito De Luz Group

texts.en:
Olintepeque is a town in the Guatemalan Department of Quetzaltenango in the Western Highlands.  It is not far from the city of Quetzaltenango and has a rich history.  It is here that the legendary K’iche king Tecún was murdered by the infamous Pedro de Alvarado.  Olintepeque has beautiful mountains to the west of the city and as the crow flies is not too far from beautiful Lake Atitlan.  The Friendship Trust Bank “Rayito de Luz” meaning “Little Ray of Light” is located here. 

There are eight women who make up the group.  In April of 2014, they received their first loan from KIVA.  The women are very grateful to KIVA investors for helping their businesses grow which has had a very beneficial financial impact on their families.  Now they are ready to request a second loan.    

One member of “Rayito de Luz” is 35 year-old Sebastiana who is married and has five children.  Sebastiana sells ice cream at bus stops.  She says that with a new loan, she can buy more products, as well as buy an ice cream cart so that she and her husband can successfully expand their business. 

“Rayito de Luz” members report that the Trust Bank’s non-formal education segments at their monthly meetings given by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer,  have given them useful tools in their personal and business lives. Some of the topics covered, including self-esteem, empowerment, goals and dreams, have helped the women gain confidence. The ladies have gained useful business tools with new knowledge about budgeting, accounting, marketing, pricing and customer service. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus” and it works. 

The women are extremely grateful to the KIVA investors for their valued support! Thank you!

loans.use: buy an ice cream cart

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: María es una joven emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogo, pero además vende saldo para teléfonos, obteniendo mejores ingresos económicos. Ella vive junto a su grupo familiar desde hace 3 años en vivienda propia, por lo que se siente feliz de tener un lugar donde vivir. María desea comprar los productos de belleza al contado, ya que de esta manera su margen de ganancia es mayor, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas corporales, champú, desodorantes, lociones, maquillaje, etc., y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a young entrepreneur who earns a living selling beauty products by catalog, but she also sells pre-paid phone minutes to earn more income. 

She has been living with her family in her own house for three years, and she is happy to have a place to live. 

María wants to purchase beauty products for cash, as her profit margin is greater this way.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in body creams, shampoo, deodorants, lotions, makeup, etc.  In this way, she will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in body creams, shampoo, deodorants, lotions, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida hails from the town of Dulag, Leyte. She engages in food vending business. She sells home- made meals like pansit (noodles), hotdog, and fried shrimp. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs. She is 35 year old married woman with four children ages 16-2 year old respectively. She is out of capital to continue operate her business. 

She  is asking for a loan to buy supplies for food vending like meat, seasonings, vegetables and purchase pig feed. These will help Loida prepare more home meals to sell. In this way, her hog raising business will slowly improve. She could now pay her obligation and able to do some expansion.

Loida dreams to expand her business to make it successful in the future to come.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat, vegetables, and pig feed

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is married and blessed with three children. She sends all of them to school with the earnings she generates from operating her beauty salon. She has operated the salon for three years. In such hard times, she is a woman with a firm belief in empowering women through beautification and fulfilling their beauty-related dreams.

Fozia is requesting a loan to buy a stock of beauty products such as mascara, bleaching creams, and make-up kits. She will use this loan to help improve her beauty parlor and thus help improve the standard of living for her family. Fozia hopes to continue to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of beauty products such as mascara, bleaching creams, and make-up kits

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard  and her son live in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Nvard graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, the faculty of Pedagogy and Methodology. From a very young age till today, she has worked at the school as a teacher of elementary classes. Now her pedagogical experience is 30 years already, and during the past years she became a greatly respected and beloved pedagogue. 

Nvard also has a group of pupils at her house she works with to help on their lessons; she also explains them some materials from the lessons that they did not manage to understand at the school. 

Nvard hopes that Kiva lenders will help her with loan amount to help her buy a computer and some methodological literature for her teaching activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some methodological literature for her teaching activities

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
A senhora o de 31 anos de idade, solteira, comerciante, mãe de 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino secundário, e outro o ensino primário vive em casa própria.
Pretende com o valor do empréstimo comprar: duves, mantas, caixas de Rachel, caixas de palone, para ampliar o seu negocio a cliente vende em regime ambulatório distribui e recolhe os valores no final do mês.
A cliente tem como sonho, ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família, e construir um aviário para a criação e venda de frangos bem como comprar uma viatura.
Tem como principais desafios financeiros, o transporte porque lhe facilitaria no seu negocio, tem recorrido ao xitique e ao empréstimo para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Marta is 31 years old. She's a vendor and a single mother of two children, one of whom attends secondary school and the other child attends primary school. She lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she intends to purchase duvet covers, blankets, boxes of meat and boxes of bologna so that she can expand her business. She sells her products door-to-door and collects payments at the end of each month.
Her dream is to expand her business in order to meet her customers' needs. She also dreams of finishing her house so she can provide a better home for her family. Another dream is to build an aviary for raising and selling chickens, and also to buy a vehicle.
Her main challenges are her finances and the matter of transportation, which would facilitate her business. She has been using rotating credit and loans as a way of overcoming her struggles and achieving her goals.

loans.use: to purchase duvet covers, blankets, boxes of meat and boxes of bologna so that she can expand her business.

loans.name: Raul

texts.pt:
o senhor Raul de 35 anos de idade, casado, trabalhador, pai de 2 filhos ainda menores é também responsável pela sua mãe e 1 sobrinha, vive em casa própria.

Pretende com o valor do empréstimo comprar: cimento, arreia branca, varroes, chapas de zinco, e pagamento da mao-de-obra para concluir a varanda e rebocar a casa.

O cliente tem como sonho formar se em direito, concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família e abrir um negocio  para aumentar a renda familiar, tem como principais desafios financeiros, tem recorrido ao empréstimo para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Raul is 35 years old. He's married and in the workforce. He has two underage children and he's also responsible for his mother and a niece. He lives in a house that he owns.

With the amount of the loan he intends to purchase cement, white sand, rods, zinc plates, and to pay for labor so he can finish his porch and plaster his house.

His dream is to get a degree in law, finish his house so he can provide a better home for his family, and start a business in order to improve his family's income. His main challenges are financial. He has been using loans as a way of overcoming his struggles and achieving his goals.

loans.use: to purchase cement, white sand, rods, zinc plates, and to pay for labor so he can finish his porch and plaster his house.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Silvio es un muchacho de familia humilde con ganas de salir siempre adelante con estudio y trabajo digno. Vive con mis padres y hermanos. 
Está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería eléctrica, y por medio de su profesión quiere abrirse camino y poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Silvio is a young man who comes from a humble family. He is always eager to move forward with his studies and be able to find a decent job. Silvio lives with his parents and siblings.

He is studying for a degree in Electrical Engineering. Through this profession, he wants to open doors for himself and be able to help his family and loved ones.

Silvio is requesting a loan in order to pay his degree fees so that he can continue his studies just as before. He appreciates the opportunity he has received to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, shampoo, rice, beans, sugar, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her farming activity by modern farming techniques for more income and better family living standards.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.pt:
O senhora Sofia de 28 anos de idade, casada, comerciante, mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 1 estuda, e 3 não tem idade escolar vive em casa própria.
Pretende com o valor do empréstimo comprar: cabelos, tissagem, mecha, fogão, geleira, para revender, a cliente vende em regime ambulatório faz entrega e recolhe o valor no final do mês.
O cliente tem como sonho abrir uma loja grande em casa  e ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Seu principal desafio é financeiro, tem recorrido ao xitique e ao empréstimo para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Sofia is 28 years old and married. She's a vendor and a mother of four children, one of whom studies and three are below school age. She lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she intends to purchase hair, hair weaves, hair extensions, a stove and a refrigerator for re-selling. She sells door-to-door, makes deliveries and then collects payments at the end of each month.
Her dream is to open a large store in her house and expand her business in order to meet her customers' needs.
Her main challenge is her finances. She has been using rotating credit and loans as a way of overcoming her struggles and achieving her goals.

loans.use: to purchase hair, hair weaves, hair extensions, a stove and a refrigerator for re-selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en: Suraiya is a 60-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. She has been doing a business of selling animals for many years. Suraiya is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life through her work. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 27 years old. He lives with his parents in the Tsnori district of the Kakheti region. The family is involved in agricultural activities.  They have a cow and produce dairy products to resell. 

Irakli wants to expand the business and purchase sheep. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 5,100 GEL. With the money, he will buy sheep and resell lambs. This will increase his family income. 

Irakli awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and start a husbandry business

loans.name: Intesar

texts.en:
Intesar is 46 years old and married, with one child. 

She started working in commerce in clothes and has managed to raise her standard of living.
She is sells cosmetics and clothes.  She has been in this business for many years. 

One of the most critical difficulties is not having money to buy products. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell and expand her work.  That will increase her income, and she will be able to help her husband more and more.


In the future, Intesar hopes to open a shop for clothes, increase her income, and build a new house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell and expand her work.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima  is a happily married woman. 

Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home.  Her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Saima is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching.  Due to a shortage of raw material, however, she is facing a difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. 

With the loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth, to stitch up more dresses on time and generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth, to stitch up more dresses and generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 35 years of age, married with one child, and a resident of Kiyaga, Rukungiri Municipality. 

Elias is a repeat customer to the institution and is applying for a loan of UGX 2,000,000. 

Elias’s main activity is agricultural sales especially the sale of coffee, maize and beans. He says agricultural produce business is profitable, but his main challenge has been limited capital. 

Elias hopes this loan facility will bridge the financial gap and he will be able to earn enough income to sustain himself and his family. His future plan is to have a maize or coffee plantation that generates adequate income for future investments. 

Thanks to UGAFODE for that financial support, he looks forward for the continued assistance.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ESTA EN ESPERA DE SU PRIMER HIJO, LO QUE FUE MOTIVO DE FELICIDAD SE VOLVIO UNA PREOCUPACION YA QUE TUVO AMENAZA DE ABORTO EN LOS PRIMEROS MESES POR LO QUE TUVO QUE RENUNCIAR A SU TRABAJO. SU ESPOSO TIENE UN SUELDO BAJO POR LO QUE ELLA LO APOYABA. AHORA CON SU EMBARAZO DE RIESGO SU ECONOMIA SE VIO AFECTADA.
texts.en:
This woman is expecting her first child. Her moment of happiness turned to a cause for concern when it was thought that she would miscarry in the first few months of her pregnancy. For this reason, she had to quit her job. She had been working because her husband earns a low salary.

Now that she is dealing with a high-risk pregnancy, her family’s finances have been affected.

loans.use: to pay for her labor and delivery expenses.

loans.name: Fidel Jr

texts.en:
Fidel Jr lives in Getafe, Bohol. He raises and sells hogs. He is 38 years old and has a 13-year old daughter.   

He has been raising hogs for more than 10 years now. He encounters a shortage of  funds to support his hog-raising business. 

Fidel Jr. has requested a loan to buy pig feed and supplements. These will help him and his family augment his livelihood. With the money, he could raise and sell healthy hogs in few months to come. This will improve his income and help him handle his finances.

He is dedicated enough to expand his current livelihood to support his child's needs, including quality education.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplements

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 50-year-old married woman who has a business selling animals. She has been running her business with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of six children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing. She has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves in order to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt:
A virginia é solteira de um filho menor  de idade,nao tem outras pessoa na sua responsabilidade,é trabalhaora de uma empresa do estado e vive na casa do serviço.
Com o dinheiro do emprestimo vai comprar ferro, cimento e pagar a mao de obra aos pedreiros.
O seu maior sonho é concluir a sua casa para viver com o seu filho, continuar a estudar para progredir de carreira profissional para bem estar da sua familia.
Os principais desafio é continuar a estudar para permitir a sua pregressão profissional e pagar escola dos seu filho para garantir o seu futuro
texts.en:
Virginia is the single mother of an underage son. She isn't responsible for anyone else. She works for a state-owned company and lives in company housing.
With the amount of the loan she will purchase iron, cement, and pay for the bricklayers' services.
Her biggest dream is to finish the house where she'll live with her son. She also dreams of moving forward with her studies so that she can succeed in her career for her family's sake.
Her main challenge is moving forward with her studies in order to get ahead professionally. Another challenge is paying for her son's education as a way of ensuring his future.

loans.use: to purchase iron, cement, and to pay for the bricklayers' services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family's house.

loans.name: Yesid Alberto

texts.es: Yesit de 40 años de edad,  es propietario de una tienda de víveres que se encuentra ubicada en Cartagena de Indias, su idea de negocio surgió por la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia, por muchos años trabajó para una empresa multinacional de consumo masivo y al darse por terminado su contrato, utilizó el dinero recibido como capital inicial, gracias a ello empezó a funcionar su negocio.   Es padre de dos hijos de 12 y  9 años de edad,  por quienes trabaja muy comprometido para lograr las utilidades esperadas y ofrecerles bienestar, de hecho su meta familiar es continuar educando sus hijos para que tengan un futuro prometedor. Aunque su principal desafío ha sido promover estrategias para contrarrestar a la competencia su negocio se ha mantenido por muchos años, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la compra de víveres como arroz, panela, aceite, azúcar, jabones y demás artículos de la canasta familiar.  Yesid considera que esta inversión mejora el stock de productos de alta rotación y se genera un dinamismo en la reinversión del capital para mantener surtida la tienda de víveres, en consecuencia los clientes estarán más satisfechos por encontrar todo  los artículos requeridos en un mismo lugar.
texts.en:
Yesid, 40, is the proprietor of a grocery store which can be found in Cartegena de Indias,  The idea for his business arose out of the necessity to generate income for his family.  For many years, he worked for a multinational company of large consumption and when his contract ran out, he used the money received as the initial capital.  Thanks to that, his business began to function.  
He is the father of two children, 12 and nine, for whom he works very committedly in order to obtain the hoped-for goods and to offer them well-being.  As such, his family goal is to continue educating his children so they have a promising future.  Although his principal challenge has been to promote strategies in order to counteract the competition, his business has maintained for many years.  
These days, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that he makes through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo to invest in the purchase of groceries such as rice, brown sugar, sugar, oil, soaps, and other household items.  Yesid considers that this investment will improve his stock of products of high turnover and generate a dynamism in the reinvestment of capital in order to keep the store stocked with groceries.  As a consequence, the customers will be more satisfied to find the things they require in the same place.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, brown sugar, sugar, oil, soaps and other household items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his butcher shop with meat varieties for more income to improve family living standards.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu,a forty-eight-year old married man, has fifteen children living in Masindi, Uganda. 

He used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He deals in farming  on a large scale and this has helped him to earn a living. He is a very hard working man and has great hopes of having all his children educated. 

He hopes to see a better future for his children though he is affected by weather changes and financial constraints. He requests a loan to help him pay workers weeding in his gardens.

loans.use: to help him pay workers weeding in his gardens.

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
A Laura tem 2 filhos, todos maior de idade e um é que vai a escola, tem mias 2 pessoas na sua responsabilidade que são os netos,vive na casa própria,vende  produtos da machamba e conta com ajuda do seu filho.
Com o dinheiro do emprestimo vai comprar cimento, chapas de zinco,barrotes e portas.
O seu sonho e esperança é construir uma mercearia, melhorar as condições de habitaçao, pagar escola para o seu filho e netos, ter uma viatura para facilitar o seu trabalho comercial bem como ter maior confiança com a micro finança para garantir ter mais emprestimos.
Os principais desafios :pagar escola para o seu filho e netos,construir uma mercearia para sustentar os seus filhos.
texts.en:
Laura has two adult children, one of whom is in school. She's also responsible for her two grandchildren. She lives in a house that she owns. She sells farm produce and gets help from her son.
With the money from the loan she'll purchase cement, zinc plates, beams and doors.
Her hopes and dreams are to open a grocery store, improve her living conditions, pay for her son's and her grandchildren's education and get a car that facilitates her business. She also hopes to gain more trust in microfinancing in order to guarantee other loans.
Her main challenges are paying for her son's and her grandchildren's education and setting up a grocery store as a way of supporting her children.

loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc plates, beams and doors.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam, who appears in the photo,  is a 41-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is the father of four kids. He works as an employee in the public sector. 

He gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs. He would like to improve his family living conditions and buy all that they need.

Husam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house to enable him to provide clean water for his family.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Abilio

texts.pt:
O senhor Abílio de 52 anos é pensionista do ministério da defesa nas horas livres dedica se a venda de produtos na sua casa e  actualmente trabalha como segurança, casado e pai de 3 filhos a estudarem,sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ele. 
Com o valor do emprestimo diz que vai comprar refrescos, cervejas, vinhos,  bolachas, acucar, feijao, massas para a sua barraca.
O projecto para o futuro crescer no negocio satisfazendo as necessidades dos seus clientes.
O seu maior desafio e a insuficiencia de fundos mas diz que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para tal vai pagar pontualmente.
texts.en:
Abílio is 52 years old and a pensioner of the ministry of defense. In his spare time he sells merchandise from home. He currently works as a security guard. He's married and has three children who are in school. He also supports two grandchildren who live with him.
He states that with the amount of the loan he'll purchase refreshments, beer, wine, crackers, sugar, beans and noodles for his stall.
His project for the future is to make his business grow by meeting his customers' needs.
His main challenge is the lack of funds. However, he states that he'll apply for more loans and because of that he'll repay this loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase refreshments, beer, wine, crackers, sugar, beans and noodles for his stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and gravel in order to build a security wall around his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia has successfully built her business of milk selling with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. 

By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously,with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a forty-three-year old married man with three children living in Masindi,Uganda. 

He sells dry food stuffs (produce) but also deals in farming though not on a large scale. He started the business to cater for his family needs. 

He is very hard working despite being challenged by floods and high transport costs to deliver his services. Patrick will use the loan to buy dry food stuffs for selling.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs  like rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Américo

texts.pt:
De 73 anos de idade é pai de 5 filhos já maiores de idade e a viver nas sua casas, sustenta dois 2 netos  que vivem com ele na casa própria. 
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar batata, cebola, tomate bolachas óleo para revender na sua banca que esta na sua casa.
No futuro pretende construir dependências para arrendamento para reforçar a renda familiar uma vez que ja tem uma idade avançada e não puder mais trabalhar.
Diz ainda que compromete se a honrar com o contracto do empréstimo  pagando pontualmente e  que ira solicitar mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Américo is 73 years old. He has five adult children who already live in their own homes. He supports two grandchildren who live with him in a house that he owns.
He states that with the amount of the loan he'll purchase potatoes, onions, tomatoes, crackers and cooking oil. He'll re-sell them at the stall he runs at his house.
In the future he intends to build rooms for renting out as a way of improving his family's income, as he's already elderly and may not be able to work for much longer.
He also states that he pledges to honor the loan agreement by repaying it in a timely fashion. He states that he'll apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, onions, tomatoes, crackers and cooking oil.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam, who appears in the photo, is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city and is the father of two sons and one daughter. 

He works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs. He would like to improve his family living conditions and buy all that they need.

Husam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Christophe

texts.en:
Christophe is 45 years old. He is married, with five children, ages 1 to10 years; three of them go to school. 

He is a farmer, and he has been in a business for the past 10 years.  His wife is a business woman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cattle for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children, to pay medical insurance. and to buy another cow for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for rearing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides so as to improve his agricultural produce and meet the demands of customers in the market.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 46-year-old woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She is a widow with five children and works very, very hard to look after her children. She also sells milk as a side-income business. She hopes to educate her children, though she has no other support from anybody else. She is in need of a loan to buy soft drinks and a refrigerator for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and a refrigerator for the restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct  a house

loans.name: Geresomu

texts.en:
Geresomu is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He used his previous loan to buy more beans and maize to sell. He has been able to look after his family. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more maize to sell.  He still faces challenges of  price fluctuations that affect his produce business. 

He has a vision of owning a big store, educating his children, and diversifying his business.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Muneeran

texts.en:
Muneeran  is a 45-years-old  married woman. The man shown in the photo is Muneeran ’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Muneeran  has applied for a loan of 50000 PKR, for her husband. 

He wants  to buy new tires for the vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Muneeran  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en: Nato is 24 years old. She lives in the small village of Kvarelii district with her husband, two children and pensioner grandmother. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow and two calves. Nato produces cheese every day and sells it locally. Nato wants to grow watermelon on family-owned land. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,600 GEL. With the received credit, she will cultivate the land and will purchase watermelon seeds. The family will sell the harvested watermelon and will increase family income.

loans.use: to cultivate family-owned land and purchase watermelon seeds

loans.name: Alam

texts.en:
Alam  is 48 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals along with her husband who is also shown in the photo. 

She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 35,000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees  is a 59-years-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Balqees ’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Balqees  has applied for a loan of 45000 PKR, for her husband. 

He wants  to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Balqees  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires  with some auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Sadafmoh

texts.en: This is Sadafmoh. She is 49 years old, married and a very good mother. She lives with her family in the district of Pyandj. Sadafmoh lives in the region where most of the people are involved in agriculture since there is no other work. Sadafmoh has six years of experience in this activity. Recently, Sadafmoh applied for a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting. Sadafmoh wants to get things right to yield more income in this cropping season. If she does not get a harvest, she will not be able to feed her family. Your support is very important for Sadafmoh. Please help her so she can plant crops and support her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides to improve her agricultural produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a plot for farming activities to gain more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his farming activities for more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pigs to raise, feed, and vitamins so he can expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow, to increase the number of liters of milk she supplies to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides for high production, and thus meet the demands of customers in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a piece of land to costruct a house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un hombre de 32 años de edad es casado, trabaja en un pequeño negocio que tiene junto con su papa donde realizan muebles de madera.  Su papa desde hace ya varios meses dejo de trabajar ya que encontraron una afección junto con presión ocular en su ojo derecho por lo que perdió la vista irreversiblemente, el Cirujano recomienda  realizar una extracción ya que esto le produce constantes dolores de cabeza.
texts.en: The borrower is a 32-year-old married man.  He works with his father at a small business where they make wooden furniture.  Several months ago his father had to quit working due to ocular pressure in his right eye, which resulted in irreversible vision loss.  It is recommend that he undergo surgery or else he will be experiencing constant headaches.

loans.use: to pay for his father's eye surgery.

loans.name: Diana Fernanda

texts.es: A sus 29 años de edad Diana es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, uno de 7 años una de 5 y la otra de 2 años edad, los 2 mayores estan estudiando. Diana crecio en un hogar humilde, junto a su madre y hermanos se dedica al comercio de verduras osea que es un negocio familiar.  Diana esta casada, su esposo trabaja de jornalero y aveces de abañil. Diana solicita el credito para invertirlo en la comprar de verduras. La aspiracion que tiene Diana es la de comprar mercaderia y asi lograr que sus ventas e ingresos aumenten y esto le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos ya que en la actualidad carecen de recursos como para cubrir todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
At 29 years old, Diana is a single mother with 3 children, a son age 7 and two daughters ages 5 and 2. The 2 oldest children are studying in school. Diana grew up in a humble household, along with her mother and siblings. She makes a living selling vegetables in a business owned by her family. Diana is married, and her husband works as a day laborer, and sometimes as a bricklayer.

Diana is requesting a loan to buy vegetables. Diana's aspiration is to buy more merchandise and, in doing so, increase her sales and earn more income. This would enable her to improve the quality of life of her children, since currently they lack some of the resources to cover their needs.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to improve his crop production.

loans.name: Amone

texts.pt:
O senhor Amone tem 51 anos de idade e viúvo pai de 5 filhos dos a quais 4 a estudar 1 já maior de idade não sustenta mais ninguém e vive na casa própria.
Com o valor vai comprar cimento, janela, porta e varrões para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Para o futuro  tem como planos terminar a sua obra, mobilar  confortando assim a sua família.
Diz ainda que irá pagar pontualmente  e  solicitar outros creditos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Amone is 51 years old and a widow. He has five children, four of whom are in schol and one is already an adult. He doesn't support anyone else and lives in a house that he owns.
With the loan he'll purchase cement, windows, a door and rods so that he can continue the construction work.
His plan for the future is to finish his house and furnish it, thereby providing comfort for his family.
He also states that he'll repay the loan in a timely fashion and apply for other loans so he can achieve his plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, windows, a door and rods.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ella a la vez que estudia también trabaja, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería industrial, y comenta que su meta es terminar la carrera, ejercer su profesión y tener un futuro mejor.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de estudiar.
texts.en:
Liz is from the city of San Ignacio. She is a student who is also working. Liz is studying for a degree in Industrial Engineering. She says that her goals are to finish her degree, pursue her profession, and have a better future.

Liz is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her fees. This will enable her to continue her studies just as before. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can study.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizers and certified seeds for planting so as to improve her agricultural produce and meet the demands of clients.

loans.name: Maria Olivia

texts.es: Los platos típicos es un negocio muy rentable, por lo que María desde hace 6 años se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo papas fritas, yuca, pasteles de carne, tostadas de plátano, nuégados, etc., y es en ello que se apoya para salir adelante junto a su compañero de vida. La vivienda de María es muy humilde y está hecha de lámina, pero en ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos a los que siempre busca la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida. Para la preparación de platos típicos se necesitan muchos ingredientes, por lo que la inversión en mucha, por lo que María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: yuca, plátanos, maíz, tomates, carne, aceite, entre otros productos necesarios para la elaboración de los platos típicos que tanto gustan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Traditional food is a very profitable business, so María has made a living for six years making and selling french fries, yucca, meat pies, fried plantains, nougat, and other items.  This is how she supports herself to move forward with her life partner.  María's home is very humble and made of metal sheeting, but she lives with her life partner and their two children and is always looking to improve their quality of life.  

In order to prepare traditional dishes, she needs many ingredients, which means a big investment up front, so María is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  She will purchase yucca, plantains, corn, tomatoes, meat, oil, and other necessary products so she can make the traditional dishes her customers love.

loans.use: to purchase yucca, plantains, corn, tomatoes, meat, oil, and other products needed to make traditional dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools and inputs so as to get a better harvest and meet the demands of clients and his family's needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so as to meet the demands of his customers in milk supply and his family's needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more retail goods for sale to meet customers' demand.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is thankful that he was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which he used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in his general store. Through his earnings he is able to send his children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

He would now like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles. He also sells fish at retail. He is positive that more items will yield more sales and thus increase his earnings. His business earnings are a stable source to sustain his family's basic needs and for the education of his children. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to him. 

Joselito dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give his children the best education possible so they can have a better future. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which he studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Kitabi & Kichwamba Schools

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Rev. Fr Gervase. He is the Director of Kichwamba High School and Kitabi Seminary School. Kichwamba is mixed school  in the rural area of Rubirizi, with 750 students. Kitabi is a boys’ school in the rural area of Kabwohe in Sheema, with 500 students.
 
Kichwamba High School and Kitabi Seminary School have requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for their students. The schools do not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore have to spend a considerable portion of their budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water filtration systems will save the schools money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with 750 and 450 liter tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kichwamba High School and Kitabi Seminary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Rev. Fr Gervase ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance, by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for their students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un joven  de 22 años de edad es casado trabaja como encargado en un negocio de comida desde hace cinco años. Necesita una cirugía refractiva ya que para realizar sus tareas habituales necesita siempre de sus lentes. Requiere de un procedimiento quirúrgico que disminuya el riesgo de agujeros en la retina ya que cuenta con una graduación muy alta.
texts.en:
This young man is 22 years of age and married. He has been working as a manager at a food business for the past five years. He needs to undergo refractive surgery so that he can go about his normal duties, which currently require him to always wear glasses.

Having this surgery will reduce the risk of developing holes in his retina since there is a high probability of this happening at the moment.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tomatoes for selling, as a spurce of income for her family

loans.name: João

texts.pt:
O senhor João é pedreiro e carpinteiro tem 37 anos é casado pai de  3 filhos todos a estudarem sustenta seu pai que vive com ele na casa própria. 
Com o valor do empréstimo diz que vai comprar cimento, chapas, barrotes e janelas para a cobertura de sua casa.
O projecto para o futuro terminar a obra, ter uma carpintaria na sua casa como forma de reforcar a renda familiar. 
O seu maior desafio e a insuficienca de fundos mas diz que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para tal vai pagar pontualmente.
texts.en:
João is a mason and a carpenter. He's 37 years old and married. He has three children, all of whom are in school. He also supports his father who lives with him in a house that he owns.
He states that with the amount of the loan he'll purchase cement, metal plates, beams, and windows so he can roof his house.
His project for the future is to finish the construction work and set up a carpenter's shop at his house as a way of improving his family's income.
His biggest challenge is the lack of funds. However, he states that he'll apply for more loans, and to that end he'll repay this loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase cement, metal plates, beams, and windows.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 44 hardworking married man with 4 children of ages 14, 12, 10 and 06 years living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a retail shop to earn income and meet family demands. He also gets extra income from farming and mobile selling of second hand clothes in different markets. 

He has a smart vision of constructing a good residential house, though he is limited by inadequate capital. 

He is requesting a loan to buy sugar, cassava flour, rice, salt and juice to sell to his customers

loans.use: to buy sugar, cassava flour, rice, salt and juice to sell to his customers

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 32-year-old married man who lives in Kasese with three children; all go to school. He has a textile shop on a busy street, and also does farming and sells and buys coffee to get additional income.

Moses has a dream of making another shop of the same items in another center. However, limited capital and market competition are his challenges faced.

Moses wants to develop himself and needs money to buy shirts, school bags, trousers, dresses, and baby wear for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes, such as shirts, school bags, trousers, dresses and baby wear, to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metals and iron bars for selling, so that he may eventually open a shop

loans.name: Tinatin

texts.en:
Tinatin is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and son in the small village of Zugdidi. 

Her husband works as a taxi driver, and generates a small income. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 0.8 hectare of agricultural land, where they grow vegetables and 150 nut trees. They also have 15 hens. They sell the harvested nuts locally, at a good price.

Tinatin wants to start a business selling used clothes, and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL. With the loan, she will purchase a stock of used clothes to resell. This will enable her to generate a stable income.

loans.use: to begin selling used clothes

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en: Ismail is 25 years old and married with two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a motorcycle transporter commonly known as ‘’bodaboda’’ and gets additional income from a retail shop which his wife manages. He started the motorcycle transport business four years ago and continues to see progress despite challenges of unfriendly weather conditions and inadequate capital which limits his profits. However, he works hard to raise income for the family and pay school fees for his children. He used the first loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. Ismail has asked for a loan to buy materials like sand, cement and timber to complete building his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like sand, cement and timber to complete building his house

loans.name: Kids Care School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Peter. He is the Head teacher of Kids Care Nursery and Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Nyendo in Masaka with 700 students. 

Kids Care Nursery and Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kids Care Nursery and Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Peter ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Ana Elsy

texts.es: .Ana es una mujer de 36 años de edad que cada día busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia apoyada en su negocio de venta de mariscos y pescado, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia y amabilidad con los clientes cada día la prefieren más. Ana vive junto a su grupo familiar en vivienda propia pero humilde desde hace 5 años. Ana desea invertir en su negocio ya que no logra cumplir con la demanda de productos que sus clientes solicitan, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pescado, camarones, langostas, etc., y de esta manera cumplir con lo que sus clientes solicitan
texts.en:
Ana is a 36-year-old woman that each day looks for a way to get her family ahead, leaning on her business of seafood and fish sales. She has had this occupation for 15 years. Thanks to her experience and kindness, her customers prefer her more every day. Ana has lived with her family group in her own but humble home for 5 years now. 

Ana wishes to invest in her business since she fails to meet the products' demands that her customers request. This is why she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in fish, shrimp, lobster, etc., and this way, meet what her customers request.

loans.use: to invest in fish, shrimp, lobster, etc., to sell on the street.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Twegonze Kigangaizi Women's Group

texts.en:
Safinah whose hand is raised in a group photograph is a forty-year-old married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She sells fish as her major business and this has enabled her to look after her family very well. She also has a restaurant and a bar that supplements her income. She has a hardship of high food prices and high license fees. Safinah has great hopes of taking her business to greater heights.

She is requesting a loan to buy fish for selling.

loans.use: to buy fish for selling.

loans.name: Yosam

texts.en: Yosam is a 43-year-old male, who is married with 8 children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Yosam operates a textile shop and is also a farmer growing coffee to get additional income. He has been in that business since 2000. Yosam is a hard working man with a dream of expanding his business and completing his rental houses although he is faced with a challenge of limited capital. Yosam intends to use the loan to buy cement and bricks and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of shoes and sandal varieties, meet the demands of her customers, raise more income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is aged 33 and a hardworking married man with 4 children ranging in age from 1 to 8 years old. Two of his children attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He operates a retail shop mainly selling general merchandise like salt, sugar, and cooking oil among other items. He hopes to expand and pay school fees for his children despite the challenge of price fluctuations of retail products. He will use the loan to buy more stock like salt, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like salt, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is a 63-years-old married woman. She lives in the small village of Khelvachauri district with her husband and son. The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow different kinds of vegetables to sell. 

Nunu wants to open a beauty salon and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 5000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase all the needed equipment which is needed for the beauty salon. She will have stable income and will be able to employ other people in her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools and equipment to open a beauty salon

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 39 years old, hard working married man with 4 children all go to school living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Jackson runs a beer and soda depot for 3 years now. He also sells gonja (bananas) and is also a farmer. 

He has a dream of educating his children and build for them a permanent house. Jackson intends to use the loan to buy construction materials like cement for completing his family house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement for completing his family house.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 33-year-old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal Uganda.   He has a business of motorcycle transport. He started the business with a hope of earning income. He is faced with the challenges of low capital inflow and competition that hinder progress of his business. Besides that, he has the future prospects of having a permanent house. 

Ismail needs a loan to buy stone that he will use to construct his residential house and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy stone that he will use to construct his residential house and pay for labour.

loans.name: Rostevan

texts.en: Rostevan is 57 years old. He lives in the small village of Zugdidi district with his wife. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow nut trees. They sell the harvested nuts locally at a good price. Rostevan wants to purchase a cow and start producing dairy products. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. When the cow is purchased, Rostevan's wife will milk the cow every day and the family will sell dairy products. This will give them a chance to increase the family income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start producing dairy products.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 30-year-old single woman, with no children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Agnes sells blue wave water and other soft drinks to make ends meet. She has a dream of owning a house, and being freed from rental expenses, though limited capital and market competition are challenges that hinder her business growth. 

Agnes is requesting a loan to buy sand and cement, and pay for labor, to build her house.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement, and pay for labor, to build her house.

loans.name: Nurchaiym

texts.ru: Нурчайым 59 лет, вдова, есть 6 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1992 году, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Нурчайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 15 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 4,34 ГА, на котором она ежегодно выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Нурчайым составляет в среднем 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь, так как сельское хозяйство - единственный источник хорошего дохода, Нурчайым в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока и лошади. Нурчайым хочет сохранить и приумножить скот, чтобы иметь возможность накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Nurchaiym is 59 years old, a widow, and the mother of six children.  She has a secondary education.  She is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute the only source of income for her family and which she started in 1992 when she bought her first livestock for 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has four cows and 15 sheep on her farm.  She also grows beans for resale, annually, on 4.34 hectares of land.  Nurchaiym makes an average monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS), which is vastly insufficient for a decent living, since agriculture is her only source of income.  Eager to further grow her business, Nurchaiym has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 (KGS) to buy one horse and two cows.  This loan will allow her to sell larger volumes of organic milk.  Nurchaiym wants to keep her livestock and even increase her number of animals, which will help her to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy two cows and one horse in order to increase the income she makes from her livestock business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a very busy man. He has a small piece of land where he plants maize. He owns dairy cows and supplies a nearby school with milk everyday. One major problem he is facing is the high cost of cooking fuel and that is why he wants a biodigester.

loans.use: to buy a biodigester for clean cooking energy for his family.

loans.name: Gjyste

texts.en: Gjyste, who has been scheduled for a surgery soon, is in the photograph with her husband, Dode. Since they had no saved money, they’re requesting a loan from you to help them pay for the procedure. They are in their 60’s receiving a retirement pension and are parents of two married children, a girl and a boy. The son, who lives and works in Italy, helps them out financially most of the time. Even though, they live in a village and could do little rural activities, they’ve chosen not to since Gjyste is not feeling well. They plant in the garden though and have some chickens and grapevines and other orchards for their own use.

loans.use: to pay for a scheduled surgical procedure of her own.

loans.name: 05 Bắc Thọ Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lý operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Lý is 55 years old and she is married with five children. 

Lý is the group leader of the 05 Bắc Thọ Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of four members.  In 2009, Lý joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Lý has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lý hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 08 Khu 5 Bắc Sơn Group

texts.en:
Chính is a 59-year-old married woman, with 2 children.

Chính lives and works in the Bỉm Son district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture, growing pineapple. She has applied for a loan to purchase more tools with which to farm pineapple, which she will sell in the future.

Chính has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Her biggest concern is her lack of capital. She is the group leader of Nhóm 08 Khu 5 Bắc Sơn group.

With her business profit, Chinh hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to farm pineapple for sale in the future

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Lenders! The above picture presents to you Hellen, a very hardworking mother and ambitious go-getter, who is 66 years of age and hails from the Nandihills area of Kenya, a rural town in the famous Rift valley. Together with her handsome husband, they support each other as a team and have been doing mixed farming for the past 45 years. Through all those years, she has been able to take care of her family and pay school fees for her children.Her primary source of income is milk and crop farming.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She has been facing financial challenges and, because the Nandihills area has a ready market for cereals, she is seeking kindly for a loan to buy cereals to be able to improve her income level. Hellen's upbringing was challenging and she has been facing many economic problems, but this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements. She believes that through your loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Hellen has gone through training and is very honest and disciplined with finances. She hopes that through profits from her business, she will fully pay back the loan. Hellen is very visionary and hopes that through accumulated profits, she will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Tejedoras Group

texts.en:
Santiago Atitlan is a well-known and very busy town on the shores of Lake Atitlan in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. Tourists from near and far come to admire the beautiful traditional attire of the men and women. It is often quite ornate with embroidered birds and flowers.
 
Eight women have joined together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Tejedoras” or “The Weavers”. They have taken loans out from the organization previously and this is the first time they are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders. 

42 year old Juana is a member of the Trust Bank who is taking out her very first loan. She is pleased to be with the other members of the group who have the same needs and concerns as she has. Juana sells beauty products for men, women and children as well as clothing. With her loan, she plans to increase her inventory and purchase creams, lotions, perfumes, rings, necklaces as well as clothing. She knows her clientele and wants to fulfill their desires. With her anticipated income, Juana wants to meet the educational needs of her five children as well as give them nutritious food and clothing. 

Although she was not able to complete her education, Juana benefits from the educational segments of the monthly meetings. She, along with the other ladies in the group, learn about nutrition, health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants. The ladies also gain useful business tools and acquire knowledge about accounting, budgeting, customer service, marketing and pricing. These educational trainings, given in the Mayan language of the ladies, give them confidence and more self-esteem. Friendship calls the useful combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus”.

Thank you, Kiva lenders, for learning of Juana and her friends in the Trust Bank. These women are becoming agents of change in their families and their town of Santiago Atitlan!

loans.use: to increase her inventory and purchase creams, lotions, perfumes, rings, necklaces as well as clothing. This will improve the education of her children

loans.name: Estrellas De Tzununa Group

texts.en:
Tzununá is a small village on the shores of Lake Atitlán where the population works in agriculture (coffee and a special Guatemalan fruit called “jocotes”) as well as traditional textile production. Entire families, including children, work in these endeavors as life is challenging and all must work to meet the needs of the household. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Estrellas de Tzununa” is beginning their very first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. Petrona is the 19-year-old Treasurer of the Trust Bank. She is pleased to have this job and to be a member of the Trust Bank as she is acquiring more knowledge and leadership skills.  Petrona is working hard to realize her dreams as she wants to become a successful businesswoman. She fabricates beautiful and colorful bags and delivers them by the dozen each week to different locales. She has three employees who help her with this textile business. Petrona is requesting a loan that she will invest in a large quantity of various colors of thread so that she can increase production. She also would like to purchase four “jocote” trees so that she can sell fruit. 

On average, Friendship Bridge clients cannot read or write and have had little or no formal education. Their monthly meetings with a Facilitator from the organization, are of great value to the women. The “Microcredit Plus” Program combines microcredit with basic education on everyday topics including budgeting, marketing and sales, nutrition, women’s rights and self esteem. The women are eager to learn and to be successful.

We look forward to providing a follow-up report on this new Trust Bank in Tzununá. Thank you, KIVA investors, for learning of Petrona and the women in the “Estrellas de Tzununa” Trust Bank.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of various colors of thread so that she can increase her production of textiles

loans.name: Mayas Group

texts.en:
San Pedro La Laguna is located on the shores of Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. It is a small Tz’utujil-speaking Mayan village. San Pedro is a tourist destination with a number of Spanish speaking schools.  Because it caters to tourists from Europe, as well as North Americans it has a variety of good restaurants. There are also many different shops including ones that sell typical clothing. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mayas” is located here. They are completing the loan cycle from July of last year.  All the women have seen their businesses grow. Now they are asking for another loan cycle which they know they can complete successfully because of the Friendship Bridge “Microcredit Plus” monthly training they have received and learned about accounting, bookkeeping and customer relations. 

A member of the group is Maria who is 46 years old.  Every day she struggles to raise her six children who are living with her. Maya women wear an apron “delantal” that has pockets where they keep their money and other important items.  Maria sells these aprons, as well as traditional “fajas” belts that secure the “cortes” skirts the Maya women wear. The aprons and belts are very salable products in San Pedro La Laguna. With the new loan, Maria plans to buy more of the typical fabric to increase her inventory of aprons that she hopes will increase her profits.

Maria had a difficult childhood and for that reason she does not want to have her children repeat her history.  For that reason she struggles hard in her business to have her children have opportunities for development, especially through education. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mayas” gives Kiva investors many thanks for being part of the women’s success in San Pedro la Laguna, Guatemala!

loans.use: to buy more fabric to increase her inventory of aprons that she hopes will increase her profits.

texts.en: Ida has always been enthusiastic about farming. She has cultivated their squash garden in Mauswagon, Calamba and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, Ida applied for a loan to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, and to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the squash garden is ready for planting. Ida knows that she has to get things right to yield more income in this cropping season. In the future, Ida hopes to buy a carabao and goat for additional earnings for their family.

loans.name: Chitatul Group

texts.en:
Eight hard-working and determined women form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chitatul” that is beginning their third loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and the very first through Kiva. The Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines small loans and education, allows these women to have more dependable cash flow, increased productivity and sales, that leads to higher income for their families.
 
The President of the Trust Bank is Cristina who is 39 years old. She has proven herself to be an excellent leader who is a role model for the ladies. She has initiative and determination. Cristina has five children. Along with her oldest son, Cristina has opened an internet cafe that sells school supplies and has a copying machine. Her business is open from Monday through Friday. With her anticipated loan, Cristina plans to fix her copying machine and purchase more school supplies like paper, notebooks and books. With her increased income, Cristina wants to continue to support one of her children who attends the university!

The educational segments of the monthly meetings are quite useful for the women. A Friendship Bridge Facilitator shares the trainings in the indigenous language of the women using pictures, drawings, role playing and games. Subjects covered include setting goals, realizing dreams, self-esteem and women’s rights. Other topics include hygiene, health and nutrition. The ladies also acquire valuable business tools like budgeting, pricing, marketing, customer service and accounting.

Thank you, Kiva investors, for learning about Cristina and the Trust Bank. The vision of Friendship Bridge is a world in which empowered women eliminate poverty. These ladies are reaching for that goal.

loans.use: to fix her copying machine and purchase more school supplies like paper, notebooks and books. Profits will help fund her son at university

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria esta estudiando la carrera de farmacéutica, ella a la vez que estudia también trabaja, esta poniendo todo de si para poder cumplir con sus metas y con sus anhelos. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, es una persona muy sacrificada.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene. Agradece por esta nieva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir.
texts.en:
Maria is studying for a degree in Pharmacology and is also working at the same time. She is giving her best effort in order to fulfill all of her goals and wishes. Maria said that her previous loan was used to pay her university fees. She is a very self-sacrificing individual.

Maria is requesting a new loan so that she can pay her degree fees and continue her studies just as before. She appreciates this new opportunity she has received so that she can continue forward.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders, meet Juliet, a dedicated, determined, and honest mother of a lovely family. She is based in Kitale, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest maize growing regions, lending it the nickname of “maize region”. 

For the past 3 years, Juliet has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her to earn a decent income. Juliet passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funds. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family and children,” she said. 

Juliet mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village, and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance that assists small-scale farmers through giving out loans and training. Juliet is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy additional poultry. Because she has gone through training on loan management, Juliet is educated on how to utilize the loan, and to save more money. Through this loan, Juliet will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs, and expand her poultry business.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry.
